commit_message:
Use Password Generation provided by the Mistral workflows

Password generation was recently added to tripleo-common and the Mistral
workflows. This patch removes the generation code from tripleoclient as it is
no longer needed.

A list comprehension in volume manager can raise IndexError due
to unsafe assumption of input.  This change fix it by not assuming

Change-Id: I83e8ac8dcf9e84b37847d6eb09065d55e843f82e

commit_message:
Fix IndexError in volume manager

A list comprehension in volume manager can raise IndexError due
to unsafe assumption of input.  This change fix it by not assuming
list comprehension always return none empty list.  This also fixes
a snapshot DB call by using OVO.

Change-Id: I83e8ac8dcf9e84b37847d6eb09065d55e843f82e
Closes-bug: #1628340
(cherry picked from commit d96fb9a10135df062732279bac2d7eb6073872b0)

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-03-15 20:09:59.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/kvs/core.py', 'keystone/server/backends.py'], 'message': "Protect initialization with critical sections

When configured as an Apache WSGI module a race condition
is possible during keystone cache initialization.
The operation raises exception region.RegionAlreadyConfigured.
This is a result of the race condition involving global
'application' variable being initialized several times
(1 per thread).
Apache modwsgi documentation suggests protecting global objects
with thread locks.

Change-Id: Ia619cc7a1a4e4ee4d7332c3e3e215cea00ca3328
Closes-Bug: 1482271
"}]
commit_message:
Protect initialization with critical sections

When configured as an Apache WSGI module a race condition
is possible during keystone cache initialization.
The operation raises exception region.RegionAlreadyConfigured.
This is a result of the race condition involving global
'application' variable being initialized several times
(1 per thread).
Apache modwsgi documentation suggests protecting global objects
with thread locks.

Change-Id: Ia619cc7a1a4e4ee4d7332c3e3e215cea00ca3328
Closes-Bug: 1482271

subject: Retrive DB object after update
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-10-24 20:15:58.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/plugin_v1.py', 'midonet/neutron/plugin_v2.py'], 'message': "Retrive DB object after update

Revision numbers are bumped in the db flush callback.
It doesn't work well for us because we have surrounding transactions,
which would defer object flushing.

This commit workarounds the issue by retrieving DB objects again.

An alternative would be to make the base class methods provide
DB object for us, similarly to what create methods do.

I don't quite understand why expire_all() is necessary, but without
having them in update_port, get_port() sometimes (not always) see
the previous values of attributes and it makes some tests including
the following ones fail occasionally.

    neutron.tests.tempest.api.test_extension_driver_port_security.PortSecTest.test_port_sec_update_pass
    neutron.tests.tempest.api.test_extension_driver_port_security.PortSecTest.test_port_sec_update_port_failed

Closes-Bug: #1633334
Change-Id: I370a2e5e987c177c540f1a0241212de62da1d930
"}]
commit_message:
Retrive DB object after update

Revision numbers are bumped in the db flush callback.
It doesn't work well for us because we have surrounding transactions,
which would defer object flushing.

This commit workarounds the issue by retrieving DB objects again.

An alternative would be to make the base class methods provide
DB object for us, similarly to what create methods do.

I don't quite understand why expire_all() is necessary, but without
having them in update_port, get_port() sometimes (not always) see
the previous values of attributes and it makes some tests including
the following ones fail occasionally.

    neutron.tests.tempest.api.test_extension_driver_port_security.PortSecTest.test_port_sec_update_pass
    neutron.tests.tempest.api.test_extension_driver_port_security.PortSecTest.test_port_sec_update_port_failed

Closes-Bug: #1633334
Change-Id: I370a2e5e987c177c540f1a0241212de62da1d930

subject: elements: zypper: Do not pull recommended packages
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-20 18:24:53.000000000', 'files': ['elements/zypper/bin/install-packages'], 'message': "elements: zypper: Do not pull recommended packages

Recommended packages are usually useful but we normally don't need
them in order to have a working system. As a result, avoid pulling
them in when doing a regular package installation or a distribution
update. Extra packages can be pulled in using the usual '-p' parameter
or from within the elements that actually need them. The results of
this change are quite significant, resulting to gains from a few dozen
of MBs up to a few hundred depending on the selected elements.

Change-Id: I5838829c631990c7a1f3b67548accd9a603fe20c
"}]
commit_message:
elements: zypper: Do not pull recommended packages

Recommended packages are usually useful but we normally don't need
them in order to have a working system. As a result, avoid pulling
them in when doing a regular package installation or a distribution
update. Extra packages can be pulled in using the usual '-p' parameter
or from within the elements that actually need them. The results of
this change are quite significant, resulting to gains from a few dozen
of MBs up to a few hundred depending on the selected elements.

Change-Id: I5838829c631990c7a1f3b67548accd9a603fe20c

subject: Revert "Fix grub installation for RHEL"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 06:52:34.000000000', 'files': ['elements/redhat-common/pre-install.d/15-remove-grub'], 'message': 'Revert "Fix grub installation for RHEL"

This reverts commit 93425d14ce251139e0518a3a9533506dd1615f97.

This is failing the fedora-minimal build, because grub2-tools is
already installed by package-map.yaml.  With this, we download grub2 &
grub2-tools (because we're getting grub-pc) and then we try to install
it *again* with the final script we setup; rpm bails out saying
package already installed.

Looking at this more closely, I feel like this is the wrong solution,
because grub2-tools should be installed by the package-map.yaml file
even on RHEL.  The logs in bug #1627000 aren't sufficient for me to
tell exactly what is going on.

Change-Id: I884cb1e78ad8c31d985f3fc94a58091b993edd7d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix grub installation for RHEL"

This reverts commit 93425d14ce251139e0518a3a9533506dd1615f97.

This is failing the fedora-minimal build, because grub2-tools is
already installed by package-map.yaml.  With this, we download grub2 &
grub2-tools (because we're getting grub-pc) and then we try to install
it *again* with the final script we setup; rpm bails out saying
package already installed.

Looking at this more closely, I feel like this is the wrong solution,
because grub2-tools should be installed by the package-map.yaml file
even on RHEL.  The logs in bug #1627000 aren't sufficient for me to
tell exactly what is going on.

Change-Id: I884cb1e78ad8c31d985f3fc94a58091b993edd7d

commit_message:
[upstream] Revise closing exercise section

- To make a generalized exercise, this commit changes from
  Spain travel plan to a plan for a country where group members
  would like to visit.
- IRC meeting info is added to encourage students to have
  meeting for discussion.
- Let's try students to improve the patchset they first submitted
  as a draft.
- More steps would be to expand with trip details as a blueprint.

Change-Id: I3415b5dd13fcca2d615384fd189c64c5416fbba8

commit_message:
Add subgraph execution support

Add -S  option to support subgraph execution. This would allow a user
to pick which tasks to stop on.

Example:

fuel2 graph execute -S keystone-db:openstack-controller/1

will start with all keystone-db tasks and end at openstack-controller at
node-1

DocImpact

Closes-bug: 1612616

Change-Id: I42f9caf2e9c18072a2ae0447df2ba3500f687d5e

commit_message:
Change apache2 CGI module for RadosGW

In apache-2.4.7 fastcgi module is not support chunked transfer.
It breaks uploads of objects to RadosGW.
Fix available since apache-2.4.10 (vivid) and upgrade apache in MOS is not
possible, so this workaround proposed.
RadosGW runs with native CGI server on 127.0.0.1:9000 and apache uses
mod_proxy_fcgi to proxy user requests to rados.

Closes-bug: #1505273

Conflicts:
	deployment/puppet/ceph/manifests/init.pp

Change-Id: Ia3959c4009c6c673074a9b7536b1cc87834c301d
(cherry picked from commit b092234605defaf6e41b15dc949472bd4b2d04ee)

commit_message:
Add apache mod_proxy for ceph radosgw

With the switch to fcgi for radosgw we need to include mod_proxy as
mod_proxy_fcgi requires it. This change pulls in the proxy module to
resolve apache2 startup failures when ceph is enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1505273
(cherry picked from commit ac654f2a5bac67ee8bd8330cb4b8443a84b3ea28)
Change-Id: I7044b58066e70b11ed9358579a2f369ce761ee06

subject: Do not copy original maps in map_merge
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-11 17:54:31.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py'], 'message': 'Do not copy original maps in map_merge

Rather than copy the maps passed to map_merge, safely store references
to the original maps (read-only). Of course, the maps are garbage
collected in the original implementation, eventually. This is just an
optimization to avoid using extra memory before the GC takes place.

Change-Id: Ie9636e9483e91e40c9b092fbc3a0b4b8a6218685
'}]
commit_message:
Do not copy original maps in map_merge

Rather than copy the maps passed to map_merge, safely store references
to the original maps (read-only). Of course, the maps are garbage
collected in the original implementation, eventually. This is just an
optimization to avoid using extra memory before the GC takes place.

Change-Id: Ie9636e9483e91e40c9b092fbc3a0b4b8a6218685

configured.

Closes-Bug: #1635659

Change-Id: Ia0668ea473ec1e80dd8b0a1136061a430883b0ec
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit c0d0fc50418867e702430f4d655da89f794e1f73)
'}]
commit_message:
Disable ext4 userns when running in a container

/sys is read-only when using an LXD contianer due
to lxcfs. So detect if we are running the charm inside
a container and prevent ext4 userns from being
configured.

Closes-Bug: #1635659

Change-Id: Ia0668ea473ec1e80dd8b0a1136061a430883b0ec
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit c0d0fc50418867e702430f4d655da89f794e1f73)

commit_message:
Disable ext4 userns when running in a container

/sys is read-only when using an LXD contianer due
to lxcfs. So detect if we are running the charm inside
a container and prevent ext4 userns from being
configured.

Closes-Bug: #1635659

Change-Id: Ia0668ea473ec1e80dd8b0a1136061a430883b0ec
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: Fix return values of consistencygroup actions in Pure storage driver
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9535, 'name': 'Gorka Eguileor', 'email': 'geguileo@redhat.com', 'username': 'Gorka'}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12924, 'name': 'Patrick East', 'email': 'east.patrick@gmail.com', 'username': 'patrick.east'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-18 14:46:24.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/pure.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_pure.py'], 'message': 'Fix return values of consistencygroup actions in Pure storage driver

- create_consistencygroup_from_src
- delete_consistencygroup
- create_cgsnapshot
- delete_cgsnapshot

Resource updates are taken care by VolumeManager and in the above listed
actions, resource_id and resource_status are updated more than once.
Also, inconsistencies could result in some cases, for example in
delete_consistencygroup method in VolumeManager class, we update DB with
volume_id and volume_status returned from the driver by calling
db.volume_update and before calling db.volume_destroy that later updates
rest of the fields(along with updating id and status again), another
process could be reading the DB. To avoid multiple DB updates and
inconsistencies, the return values of these methods in the driver could
be set to None.

Change-Id: I0187c7ea633c3061322116a1019abb7f0df34ee3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix return values of consistencygroup actions in Pure storage driver

- create_consistencygroup_from_src
- delete_consistencygroup
- create_cgsnapshot
- delete_cgsnapshot

Resource updates are taken care by VolumeManager and in the above listed
actions, resource_id and resource_status are updated more than once.
Also, inconsistencies could result in some cases, for example in
delete_consistencygroup method in VolumeManager class, we update DB with
volume_id and volume_status returned from the driver by calling
db.volume_update and before calling db.volume_destroy that later updates
rest of the fields(along with updating id and status again), another
process could be reading the DB. To avoid multiple DB updates and
inconsistencies, the return values of these methods in the driver could
be set to None.

Change-Id: I0187c7ea633c3061322116a1019abb7f0df34ee3

commit_message:
Add sphinx extension to generate db diagram

The schemadisplay_sphinx module was included to automate the
creation of the current database diagram.  The image resulted from
the execution of tox -e docs is displayed in:

./doc/build/html/devref/db_layer.html

Depends-on: Ica3e5cc03e3978eb520f8e5863d92b93725c3331
Change-Id: I046fcff69d6de96d56c15da2b904fbc3d0775240
Closes-Bug: #1540525

commit_message:
Getting rid of bagpipe driver pointless dependency

The agent part of the bagpipe driver depends on
classes of networking_bagpipe_l2.
This patch gets rid of this dependency.
Some small refactoring of the bagpipe agent, and the bagpipe
mechanism driver are also done in this patch.

Change-Id: I87684ea56b6fc76b83958111eecef6832c4428ef
Closes-bug: #1452917

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 12:14:46.000000000', 'files': ['packaging/deb/package_deb.sh', 'packaging/rpm/package_rpm.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I968f9ac33d37dcf8186734e8669d0b43c3389575
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I968f9ac33d37dcf8186734e8669d0b43c3389575
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
[WIP]Adds 2 rest apis for enabling and disabling arp on a given mac
Uses echo int_val >> /proc/sys/net/ipv4/conf/ethX/arp_ignore
to enable the arp response on a given interface
int_val = 0 for enable, 8 for disable
ethX = interface on which we need to disable arp

blueprint : active-active-spec

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/db/db.py', 'networking_odl/ml2/mech_driver_v2.py'], 'message': "update the lock with 'compare and update' plus retry

with_for_update() would fail in mysql galera backend, this patch add a
'compare and update' lock and a immediately retry logic. It reuse
the state column('processing' indicate the lock) and last_retried
timestamp.
And for neutron HA cases, to prevent the row in locking/'processing'
sleeping for a long time, add the lock release process in timer thread.

Change-Id: I38615a236eee62cc459c65e400114aa9808a1817
"}]
commit_message:
update the lock with 'compare and update' plus retry

with_for_update() would fail in mysql galera backend, this patch add a
'compare and update' lock and a immediately retry logic. It reuse
the state column('processing' indicate the lock) and last_retried
timestamp.
And for neutron HA cases, to prevent the row in locking/'processing'
sleeping for a long time, add the lock release process in timer thread.

Change-Id: I38615a236eee62cc459c65e400114aa9808a1817

devstack gate testing.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-12 19:24:49.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'neutron_lib/callbacks/events.py', 'neutron_lib/callbacks/__init__.py', 'neutron_lib/callbacks/manager.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/callbacks/test_callback_exceptions.py', 'neutron_lib/callbacks/resources.py', 'neutron_lib/callbacks/registry.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/callbacks/test_manager.py', 'neutron_lib/callbacks/exceptions.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/callbacks/test_registry.py'], 'message': "Callback mechanism using Oslo Versioned Objects (PoC)

This is a PoC of modifying the callback mechanism to use Oslo
Versioned Objects. There are several things to note:

- Only implemented subscribe and notify methods in this PoC.
- Instead of using string for resource, use OVO class name.
- Provide param arg to notify, as some notifications provide additional
  info (e.g. context, id, old/new values). It can contain OVOs too.
- Added extra comments in tests, to describe the resources and tests.
- We don't have any OVOs ready yet, so you have to use your imagination
  a bit on how this can be used (or wait).

Change-Id: Ifaf9736d6c6480e52b0e2a0b036159c0dd4ae52e
Implements: blueprint neutron-lib
"}]
commit_message:
Callback mechanism using Oslo Versioned Objects (PoC)

This is a PoC of modifying the callback mechanism to use Oslo
Versioned Objects. There are several things to note:

- Only implemented subscribe and notify methods in this PoC.
- Instead of using string for resource, use OVO class name.
- Provide param arg to notify, as some notifications provide additional
  info (e.g. context, id, old/new values). It can contain OVOs too.
- Added extra comments in tests, to describe the resources and tests.
- We don't have any OVOs ready yet, so you have to use your imagination
  a bit on how this can be used (or wait).

Change-Id: Ifaf9736d6c6480e52b0e2a0b036159c0dd4ae52e
Implements: blueprint neutron-lib

commit_message:
Adding network driver for a vip on a single amp

This network driver is designed to expose an amphora's IP that is on the
vip subnet as the load balancer's virtual ip.  This means this driver will
only work for single topology. It could work with some other topologies but
that is beyond the intent of this code.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I11816fb68296f305a7a5e767a7b9a7a87dc0864e
Closes-Bug: #1500593

commit_message:
Adding the topology info at the time of LB AMP association

This work adds the topology info into the AMPs amphora-agent.conf
at the time of LB AMP association, as we can't determine the
topology at the time of creation of the AMP.
In the details API the value of topology is harcoded. This
patch also fixes that

Change-Id: I20a230726a1198d3b0ee685ca304f165d8f265f9
Closes-Bug:1534223

commit_message:
Add l3 vpn suport to neutron-dynamic-routing plugin

BGPVPN plugin will handle following event:
1. bgpvpn event: bgpvpn create/delete/update,
   bgpvpn associate/disassociate with router
2. router port create/delete event
3. subnetpool change address scope event
4. bgp speaker associate wth bgpvpn event

Co-Authored-By: henry.dong@cn.ibm.com

Change-Id: If0176bf20b4299ce0f5322ad3d2077bf6441b22b
Partial-Bug: #1509431

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 19:48:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/portbindings_db.py'], 'message': 'WIP Allow setting values to None in portbindings

This came up while I was trying to test segments. My guess is that no
one hits this because ML2 has its own port binding implementation.
But, many of my segments unit tests run against this one. So, I
thought it'd be good to get it right.

validators.is_attr_set is often mistaken for meaning "user didn't
supply a value." It doesn't mean that! In this context, comparing to
ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED is a clearer, and more correct, way to express
that. For binding profile, and binding_vnic, it was taken care of by
checking is not None. However, for host, the code doesn't distinguish
between not set and None.

Change-Id: I663183c167c84811f67cd1d7c7e5e5ccb5d96f52
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Allow setting values to None in portbindings

This came up while I was trying to test segments. My guess is that no
one hits this because ML2 has its own port binding implementation.
But, many of my segments unit tests run against this one. So, I
thought it'd be good to get it right.

validators.is_attr_set is often mistaken for meaning "user didn't
supply a value." It doesn't mean that! In this context, comparing to
ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED is a clearer, and more correct, way to express
that. For binding profile, and binding_vnic, it was taken care of by
checking is not None. However, for host, the code doesn't distinguish
between not set and None.

Change-Id: I663183c167c84811f67cd1d7c7e5e5ccb5d96f52

commit_message:
Add generic object AMQP notifier

Adds a notifier that listens for events using the callback system.
It reacts to these events to put the latest state of objects onto
the message bus.

This currently puts the dict result of a plugin 'get' call but it
will be replaced by oslo versioned objects as payloads when they
ready.

Change-Id: I44b690d188f47cc336df3484e65abbfa81fa1eca
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications

Adds a receiver side to the generic AMQP notifier added in
I44b690d188f47cc336df3484e65abbfa81fa1eca.

Agents can load this and subscribe to the resource types they
are interested in. This component will handle the logic of
discarding update ordering resolution and storing the bodies
for objects. It will convert these into callbacks for the
resource types that things can subscribe to as necessary.

Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications

commit_message:
Add generic object AMQP receiver

Adds a receiver side to the generic AMQP notifier added in
I44b690d188f47cc336df3484e65abbfa81fa1eca.

Agents can load this and subscribe to the resource types they
are interested in. This component will handle the logic of
discarding update ordering resolution and storing the bodies
for objects. It will convert these into callbacks for the
resource types that things can subscribe to as necessary.

Change-Id: I70e291b619559645ac3380950b2c7adccde885e2
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications

commit_message:
Fix inappropriate info when net-list -F {fields}

Run neutron net-list -F ${which not contained fields}, it will return
some inappropriate info, the expected from neutronclient is throwing
error. In this view, the result from neutron-server is just like
['network':[{},{}]], So the logic should throw an exception.
This patch fix that when the result like [{},{}], it will raise
InvalidResult exception.

Closes-Bug: #1489678
Change-Id: I23b3d3a9e9728cf946df37bfdcaefa875beb1e84

subject: WIP align address_set to set and use port sets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 04:27:47.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/common/utils.py', 'networking_ovn/common/constants.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovn_api.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/cmd/neutron_ovn_db_sync_util.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py', 'networking_ovn/common/acl.py'], 'message': 'WIP align address_set to set and use port sets

The patch refers http://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/655463/ in OVN,
which one will try to extend current Address_Set table to Set table.
Set table is a more common, than only address set, it can also accept
string values as set member.

For networking-ovn, using port-name set under Set table with ACLs will
change the way we generate ACL entries for Neutron security groups.

Before this patch, we create ACL entries per each port, such a ACL entry
will have "inport == NEUTRON_PORT_ID" or "outport == NEUTRON_PORT_ID" in
its match field. So the number of ACL entries we need to create, is in
direct proportion to ports number and SG rules number.

After this patch, we will create ACL entries per each SG rule, and port
set will tell which ports are using a SG rule. So we will have ACL entry
like:
match: "inport == $sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID" or "outport == $sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID".
The "sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID" will be a port set name, and in that set, there
are all port names(Neutron port ids), which belongs to ports are binding
to a SG rule. It tries to make number of ACL entris only be direct proportion
to SG rules number.

Since ACL entry is defined closer to a SG rule than a port, so ACL exteral_ids
will be changed to use SG rule id.

TODO:
 - fix ACL entries for non-native DHCP supporting
 - fix sg_net_mapping for delete port and port disassociate SG case
 - update for reuse ACL entries if it can get support in OVN
 - update tests.

Change-Id: Ib1e46192b987289da0729e91f5ec6e16dab4b53e
'}]
commit_message:
WIP align address_set to set and use port sets

The patch refers http://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/655463/ in OVN,
which one will try to extend current Address_Set table to Set table.
Set table is a more common, than only address set, it can also accept
string values as set member.

For networking-ovn, using port-name set under Set table with ACLs will
change the way we generate ACL entries for Neutron security groups.

Before this patch, we create ACL entries per each port, such a ACL entry
will have "inport == NEUTRON_PORT_ID" or "outport == NEUTRON_PORT_ID" in
its match field. So the number of ACL entries we need to create, is in
direct proportion to ports number and SG rules number.

After this patch, we will create ACL entries per each SG rule, and port
set will tell which ports are using a SG rule. So we will have ACL entry
like:
match: "inport == $sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID" or "outport == $sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID".
The "sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID" will be a port set name, and in that set, there
are all port names(Neutron port ids), which belongs to ports are binding
to a SG rule. It tries to make number of ACL entris only be direct proportion
to SG rules number.

Since ACL entry is defined closer to a SG rule than a port, so ACL exteral_ids
will be changed to use SG rule id.

TODO:
 - fix ACL entries for non-native DHCP supporting
 - fix sg_net_mapping for delete port and port disassociate SG case
 - update for reuse ACL entries if it can get support in OVN
 - update tests.

Change-Id: Ib1e46192b987289da0729e91f5ec6e16dab4b53e

commit_message:
delete conntrack entries properly

This patch prevents unintentional consumption of
devices_with_updated_sg_members.
Also note that this patch make
_clean_deleted_remote_sg_members_conntrack_entries method
consistent with ohter brother methods(
_clean_deleted_sg_rule_conntrack_entries and
_clean_updated_sg_member_conntrack_entries).

Change-Id: Ic448ceb8832a5b874c92f6da17b65dbda26b98dd
Closes-Bug: #1580377

commit_message:
Make subnet_id for lbaas v2 member create optional

Presently subnet_id is required for creating lbaas v2 member.
This patch makes subnet_id optional for creating the member.
If subnet id is not specified, then load balancer vip subnet_id is used.

Change-Id: I658b0fc57b14d590d502600ccda9a52582658786
Closes-bug: #1426248
Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Angus Lees <gus@inodes.org>

commit_message:
Transition to new oslo_db test fixtures

WIP - this is experimental as I get the oslo.db
API to work well for several consuming projects
simultaneously

This links to the non-merged version of oslo.db at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/345601/6 .  Uses a
shell script within tox test commands in order to
run all tests against in-progress version of oslo.db

Change-Id: I10b648412445de0fc199a4021590c683dddd16cc

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-03 16:15:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/metadata/agent.py', 'neutron/agent/metadata/config.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'GATE/GRENADE TESTING DO NOT MERGE

Deprecate nova_metadata_ip and changed to nova_metadata_host

nova_metadata_ip implies that this variable must be an
ip address. nova_metadata_ip can be either an IP or a hostname

When using a TLS encrypted session using anything other than a
hostname will result in an SSL issue. The help documentation
for this variable has also been modified to specify that if
a TLS encypted session is running this must be a hostname.

nova_metadata_host is now a MutliStringOpt, with a
deprecated name of nova_metadata_ip, and help is updated
to reflect the requirements.

Change-Id: If51ec7219481395ab19f59df6dc1557f420f6020
Closes-bug:#1585699
'}]
commit_message:
GATE/GRENADE TESTING DO NOT MERGE

Deprecate nova_metadata_ip and changed to nova_metadata_host

nova_metadata_ip implies that this variable must be an
ip address. nova_metadata_ip can be either an IP or a hostname

When using a TLS encrypted session using anything other than a
hostname will result in an SSL issue. The help documentation
for this variable has also been modified to specify that if
a TLS encypted session is running this must be a hostname.

nova_metadata_host is now a MutliStringOpt, with a
deprecated name of nova_metadata_ip, and help is updated
to reflect the requirements.

Change-Id: If51ec7219481395ab19f59df6dc1557f420f6020
Closes-bug:#1585699

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: check if tests run with different random seed

Tests are usually forked and exec()d rather than python's fork
function, but that seem to depend on test settings.
Let's confirm that by confirming every assertEqual fails with a
different value.

Change-Id: I857174c149b0be3297c676b0749c9c8d4c2912d8

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-03-24 02:35:57.000000000', 'files': ['etc/policy.json', 'neutron/tests/etc/policy.json'], 'message': 'access-control: Allow network owner to update port

Previous policy.json has rules:
  "update_port": "rule:admin_or_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc",
and:
  "update_port:fixed_ips": "rule:admin_or_network_owner or
rule:context_is_advsvc"
the port attribute rule will be "blocked" by root rule.

With rbac, after tenant-A gives tenant-B access_as_shared privilege,
tenant-B user can create a port(port-B) on tenant-A network net-A.
Later, as network owner, tenant-A user may have some plans to update
fixed_ip for port-B. But tenant-A user will fail to do that, and get
"The resource could not be found." return message, for policy check
not pass on root rule for "update_port".

Not only to fixed_ips, there are some other attributes also be blocked
now. Such as mac_address, device_owner, etc.

This patch chooses using "admin_owner_or_network_owner" to replace
"admin_or_network_owner" to fix this.

Attention, even tenant-B is owner of port-B, we shouldn't give privilige
for tenant-B to update attribute like fixed_ips for port-B on net-A.
For tenant-B cannot only get ports not belong to tenant-B on net-A, so
give tenant-B privilege to update fixed_ips will cause unnecessary IP
conflict trouble. So it should be safe to keep current rule for port
attributes on update action.

Change-Id: I57d2628128b9bc7168db77df04502573434714f9
Closes-Bug: #1534954
'}]
commit_message:
access-control: Allow network owner to update port

Previous policy.json has rules:
  "update_port": "rule:admin_or_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc",
and:
  "update_port:fixed_ips": "rule:admin_or_network_owner or
rule:context_is_advsvc"
the port attribute rule will be "blocked" by root rule.

With rbac, after tenant-A gives tenant-B access_as_shared privilege,
tenant-B user can create a port(port-B) on tenant-A network net-A.
Later, as network owner, tenant-A user may have some plans to update
fixed_ip for port-B. But tenant-A user will fail to do that, and get
"The resource could not be found." return message, for policy check
not pass on root rule for "update_port".

Not only to fixed_ips, there are some other attributes also be blocked
now. Such as mac_address, device_owner, etc.

This patch chooses using "admin_owner_or_network_owner" to replace
"admin_or_network_owner" to fix this.

Attention, even tenant-B is owner of port-B, we shouldn't give privilige
for tenant-B to update attribute like fixed_ips for port-B on net-A.
For tenant-B cannot only get ports not belong to tenant-B on net-A, so
give tenant-B privilege to update fixed_ips will cause unnecessary IP
conflict trouble. So it should be safe to keep current rule for port
attributes on update action.

Change-Id: I57d2628128b9bc7168db77df04502573434714f9
Closes-Bug: #1534954

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10267, 'name': 'venkata anil', 'email': 'anilvenkata@redhat.com', 'username': 'anil'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11159, 'name': 'Hong Hui Xiao', 'email': 'honghui_xiao@yeah.net', 'username': 'HongHuiXiao'}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 14:57:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/rpc.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/driver_context.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/rpc_manager/l2population_rpc.py'], 'message': "[l2pop] add timestamp to fdb to avoid concurrency

Port binding and status updates of a port can occur simultaneously
during migration and l2pop notifies agents for each update through RPC.
1) But these RPC calls can reach the agent at different times.
2) If they reach the agent in correct order also, agent's handlers
   might be simultaneously processing them
Because of 1) and 2) stale ovs flows might be added by agent for a port

To force synchronization, we add timestamp to PortContext during
port binding and status updates. This timestamp is passed as part of
fdb along with port.

When agent receives multiple fdbs for same port, it uses lock to
synchronize them and then fdb with latest timestamp will setup flows.
Agent also maintains dict of these port fdb(with latest timestamp).

Need work on compatibility with previous releases and
linux bridge agent changes.

Co-Authored-By: Hong Hui Xiao <honghui_xiao@yeah.net>
Related-Bug: #1611308
Change-Id: Idc3c72b657ba607a0e18b78a894ef7981ad61202
"}]
commit_message:
[l2pop] add timestamp to fdb to avoid concurrency

Port binding and status updates of a port can occur simultaneously
during migration and l2pop notifies agents for each update through RPC.
1) But these RPC calls can reach the agent at different times.
2) If they reach the agent in correct order also, agent's handlers
   might be simultaneously processing them
Because of 1) and 2) stale ovs flows might be added by agent for a port

To force synchronization, we add timestamp to PortContext during
port binding and status updates. This timestamp is passed as part of
fdb along with port.

When agent receives multiple fdbs for same port, it uses lock to
synchronize them and then fdb with latest timestamp will setup flows.
Agent also maintains dict of these port fdb(with latest timestamp).

Need work on compatibility with previous releases and
linux bridge agent changes.

Co-Authored-By: Hong Hui Xiao <honghui_xiao@yeah.net>
Related-Bug: #1611308
Change-Id: Idc3c72b657ba607a0e18b78a894ef7981ad61202

commit_message:
Add pause after reload_cfg

HUP signals handle asynchronously, which causes conflicts when multiple
signals are sent.

This change adds small pause after sending HUP signal.

Change-Id: I65be6f6365ec56696dedb5e7a538c33db1854f13
Closes-bug: #1598078

fullstack test for vm migration

Adding a new fullstack test for vm migration.
vm will created first on one host and tested for conectivity.
Then it will be migrated to another host and again we check for
vm connectivity.

commit_message:
base API v2: enrich *.delete.end notify payload

When Neutron emits notification for objects like subnet, port, router and
network being deleted, the notification payload only contain the id of the
entity being deleted.
Ceilometer needs the same amount of metadata sent for the *.create.end events,
for the *.delete.end events too.

Change-Id: Ib5d0c176eca2c3cceb23d3553bc24ffb31b7c555
Closes-Bug: 1543379

commit_message:
[WIP] Exit and log an error when vxlan_group is incorrectly set

OpenStack-Ansible was configuring[1] vxlan_group as:

vxlan_group = ''

Which would throw a warning in the neutron linuxbridge agent logs,
but wouldn't stop the agent. It would however fail to bind instances and
cause lots of other problems. Now, we'll exit hard when this situation
happens to draw attention to the operator that something is wrong.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252100/5/playbooks/roles/os_neutron/defaults/main.yml

This commit removes logging the entire json blob of routers on a
success request. This is completely unecessary and when lots of

commit_message:
Remove useless JSON blob from debug logs

This commit removes logging the entire json blob of routers on a
success request. This is completely unecessary and when lots of
router creations come in they just add noise to the logs for no
benefit.

Change-Id: Id8e138dce414e9b5468a6aa3011b330443d22c4f

commit_message:
Update nova api 2.0 to 2.1

Nova team decided to abandon the 2.0 api, so we should update the version
to 2.1.
And the nova patch had merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311653/

we should bump to use v2.1 ASAP

Change-Id: Icb606973467b2ac3ee722daa6cbce3007b6bc342
Closes-Bug: #1588171

just like the scenario appended at the test_plugin.py,
dead loop will be happen while deleting the network.
This patch set fix this bug by nuking the network and its subnets

commit_message:
Delete net throughly though it has admin's subnet

After a tenant creates a network and admin creates a subnet,
just like the scenario appended at the test_plugin.py,
dead loop will be happen while deleting the network.
This patch set fix this bug by nuking the network and its subnets
throughly whatever its subnets belong to its tenant or not.

Change-Id: I43e865d07687152da993f62696d13d7bfad01017
Closes-Bug: #1588228

commit_message:
Add some arguments of the command "quota-update"

There are some arguments should be added to the command "quota-update".
Such as "firewall", 'firewall_policy', 'firewall_rule', 'rbac_policy',
'subnetpool'.

Change-Id: Ia3558217ac1f187ead5a510e541fc07f56c4af44
Closes-Bug: #1599061

commit_message:
Fix unimport '_()' bug

In exception module of octavia, the '_()' wasn't imported, so
wen can't use it. Besides, '_LE()' will be better.

Change-Id: I1a2e524178e538b7925ea78a8d28631a8b71dc0f

revisions:

commit_message:
Using oracle Java and Skip some bad modules

When build master onos, some bad modules are blocking
whole build. This patch allows to define what app
modules to skip.

As well, use Oracle JDK since the ONOS are recommending it.

Change-Id: I3cca9cd9218ae125ba975a62437cf749f4f0ce57

commit_message:
Use osprofiler.initializer to set up osprofiler notifier

osprofiler.initializer has been introduced to osprofiler.
It does the same things as setup() in profiler.py does.
So we'd better use the API provided by osprofiler to set
up the osprofiler notifier.

Change-Id: I3a4f2fffed00c76e972160f7fc74910386cff431

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 10781, 'name': 'selvakumar', 'email': 'selvakumar.s2@hpe.com', 'username': 'selvakumar'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 11685, 'name': 'Stephen Balukoff', 'email': 'stephen@balukoff.com', 'username': 'sbalukoff'}, {'_account_id': 12040, 'name': 'A10 Networks CI', 'email': 'a10-openstack-ci@a10networks.com', 'username': 'a10networks-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14591, 'name': 'Lubosz Kosnik (diltram)', 'email': 'lubosz.kosnik@intel.com', 'username': 'diltram'}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-09 11:00:04.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/plug.py', 'octavia/tests/functional/amphorae/backend/agent/api_server/test_server_sysvinit.py', 'octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/util.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/test_utils.py', 'octavia/tests/functional/amphorae/backend/agent/api_server/test_server.py'], 'message': 'Fixed Load balancer VIP reachability issue

During network plug for the amphora-haproxy namespace, plug.py checks
for eth1.cfg under /etc/netns/amphora-haproxy/network/interfaces.d/
but in HPE linux ubuntu does not have eth1.cfg instead it will be
having eth1 so the plug.py unable to plug the vip for the eth1
interface as there is no .cfg file extension. As a result of this
VIP is not reachable for this VM.

This fix is generic as it will work for any ethernet extension
file for the VIP

Change-Id: Id74faafdaa38496b341002f8213cb1d5f2c8bab2
Co-Authored-By: Maurya Alok Kumar <alok-kumar.maurya@hpe.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed Load balancer VIP reachability issue

During network plug for the amphora-haproxy namespace, plug.py checks
for eth1.cfg under /etc/netns/amphora-haproxy/network/interfaces.d/
but in HPE linux ubuntu does not have eth1.cfg instead it will be
having eth1 so the plug.py unable to plug the vip for the eth1
interface as there is no .cfg file extension. As a result of this
VIP is not reachable for this VM.

This fix is generic as it will work for any ethernet extension
file for the VIP

Change-Id: Id74faafdaa38496b341002f8213cb1d5f2c8bab2
Co-Authored-By: Maurya Alok Kumar <alok-kumar.maurya@hpe.com>

commit_message:
Create plugin driver for F5 Networks appliances.

Implements an LBaaS v2 plugin driver for F5 Networks appliances.
The plugin implementation is a shim only, and the complete
driver implementation exists outside of the neutron-lbaas tree.
A unit test is also included in this commit.

Change-Id: I7018943c0ed2cf68e23e4ff4a82d5b9f2bd3290a
Closes-Bug: 1539717

commit_message:
WIP: Close octavia handler and n-lbaas driver gaps

First part to add in the functionality that neutron-lbaas drivers expect.
A shim layer is added that mimics calls to the neutron core_plugin but instead
actually makes a REST call.  This should be transparent to the drivers though
and based on the code that was in tree, all calls to the core_plugin should be
implemented.  However, for drivers that are just pass-through drivers, some
core_plugin may still need to be implemented.

What is still needed is a shim layer to the db that the plugins had access to.
Also, helper methods that automatically set the statuses of the resources.

Change-Id: I5d9cf03ef2a169d479282fcc0891f663bb277d4f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 12040, 'name': 'A10 Networks CI', 'email': 'a10-openstack-ci@a10networks.com', 'username': 'a10networks-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 16:03:00.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/network/drivers/neutron/base.py'], 'message': 'WIP: Active-Active Topology - fix Security Group for Distributor

SG allows a port to send only traffic from specific IPs --
disables spoofing. Distributor must send traffic with
src_ip that is not its port ip (but IP of the client) to an amphora.
This commit lets distributor while staying in security group perform such
legal spoofing

Change-Id: I1f22982160fb1bb2582ce203c5d35719f82eda44
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Active-Active Topology - fix Security Group for Distributor

SG allows a port to send only traffic from specific IPs --
disables spoofing. Distributor must send traffic with
src_ip that is not its port ip (but IP of the client) to an amphora.
This commit lets distributor while staying in security group perform such
legal spoofing

Change-Id: I1f22982160fb1bb2582ce203c5d35719f82eda44

commit_message:
Usage of flavor's get_service_profile_metainfo

Adding usage of neutron's flavor plugin new API
get_service_profile_metainfo by LBaaS's plugin.
This should be used by a selected provider to get choosen
flavor profile's meta when needed.

See neutron's flavor plugin change here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/318153.

Change-Id: I3baf2471ed20b06d2164b081452e8fd268363f01

commit_message:
Add new options to the net-update/net-create CLI

New options have been added to the net-create and net-update CLI.
Also, net-update CLI now displays all the possible updatable options.
Net-update CLI now shows the following information:
    --admin-state-up
    --shared
    --router:external

Net create now parses --router:external option.

Co-Authored-By: Reedip Banerjee <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>
Change-Id: Ib2874bc93979d338d598cc542d349b3517008e49
Closes-Bug: #1320796
Closes-Bug: #1320793

commit_message:
Add neutron-lbaas v2 providers to devstack if flavors enabled

Neutron advanced service flavors can use multiple providers, with
the flavor pointing to a flavor service profile containing the
desired provider including a non-default version, in v2 of
neutron-lbaas.

This patch adds a couple secondary neutron-lbaas providers to
the devstack configuration when 'q-flavors' is enabled.

Change-Id: I433ed832bd6c95fdce7582fdc24674acf5f912ba

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 11:32:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/v2/base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_agent.py'], 'message': "Respect agent when policy does not allow to update

When policy does not allow to perform update-agent,
neutron try to refer to 'tenant_id' of the agent in order to
judge whether 403 or 404 should be returned to client.

However, there is no 'tenant_id' attribute in agent.
Thus, accessing to 'tenant_id' is failed and unexpected error is returned.
It should be returned with 404.

Change-Id: Ie173ac7673b2f3a60f5d4048af8424810ea25750
Closes-Bug: #1610905
"}]
commit_message:
Respect agent when policy does not allow to update

When policy does not allow to perform update-agent,
neutron try to refer to 'tenant_id' of the agent in order to
judge whether 403 or 404 should be returned to client.

However, there is no 'tenant_id' attribute in agent.
Thus, accessing to 'tenant_id' is failed and unexpected error is returned.
It should be returned with 404.

Change-Id: Ie173ac7673b2f3a60f5d4048af8424810ea25750
Closes-Bug: #1610905

commit_message:

This reverts commit 74e7df482c22c3e39898bd0c55dd24352740dbe4.

Note that this will break the following subprojects, which have not
merged their hacking fix for most of newton: dragonflow, networking-brocade,
networking-plumgrid, networking-vpshere

commit_message:
Fixes failover flow with namespace driver

This patch updates the haproxy service scripts to handle the case
where the network interfaces have not yet been plugged.  This can
occur in a failover situation.
This patch also makes sure we don't move the management lan interface
into the network namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1509706
Closes-Bug: #1577963
Change-Id: I04d267bd3cdedca11f0350c5255086233cba14ec
(cherry picked from commit 7ba33e6ee4dd19757fe6f3a6bae513db49240c5e)

commit_message:
Clear SegmentHostMapping when deleting inactive agent

Admin can delete inactive L2 agent. But the SegmentHostMapping for that
agent will be left behind. This patch will clear the related
SegmentHostMapping when deleting inactive L2 agent.

Change-Id: I61dfaacf2a28bb8356ecc5f5cb12b20b2d857ddb
Partially-implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Save transaction when deleting floatingip_agent_gateway port

In dvr environment, after the last floatingip being deleted on one compute node,
the l3-agent will clear the fip namespace and call the neutron-server to delete the
floatingip_agent_gateway, but db transaction did not save after deleting the data,
so port date is still in the db.

Change-Id: Ic42a613663b226b15fd63c6f60380cfab87a7cf4
Closes-bug: #1560301

When set port tag on the br-int, br-int calls method get_ports_attributes
and given ports or none which will get all current bridge port.
If given ports does not belong to br-int, the method still can return data,
when given ports belong to br-ex, this will cause the ports on the br-ex
to be set with the tag attribute, and network unreachable.

commit_message:
A ovs bridge can only get its own port attributes

When set port tag on the br-int, br-int calls method get_ports_attributes
and given ports or none which will get all current bridge port.
If given ports does not belong to br-int, the method still can return data,
when given ports belong to br-ex, this will cause the ports on the br-ex
to be set with the tag attribute, and network unreachable.

Need to confirm whether the given ports is in the current ovsbridge.

Change-Id: I037317c7783cfdf8feaca0b293ffe2f27a0c5d9d
Closes-bug: #1616815

subject: Let vpn-agent respect FWaaS
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-29 05:23:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/agent_without_fwaas.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/agent.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/agent_with_fwaas.py'], 'message': 'Let vpn-agent respect FWaaS

Currently, we cannot use both of FWaaS and VPNaaS
because vpn-agent does not initialize FWaaS.
Class structure of FWaaS and VPNaaS causes this problem.

This patch changes structure of main class of VPNaaS.
When neutron-fwaas repository is detected,
select class that overrides main class of FWaaS as main class of VPNaaS.
On the other hand, when neutron-fwaas repository is not detected,
select class that does not override main class of FWaaS as main class of VPNaaS.

Change-Id: Ie1467743e332e8add2eeffed40b79959ae6aeda2
Closes-Bug: #1617268
'}]
commit_message:
Let vpn-agent respect FWaaS

Currently, we cannot use both of FWaaS and VPNaaS
because vpn-agent does not initialize FWaaS.
Class structure of FWaaS and VPNaaS causes this problem.

This patch changes structure of main class of VPNaaS.
When neutron-fwaas repository is detected,
select class that overrides main class of FWaaS as main class of VPNaaS.
On the other hand, when neutron-fwaas repository is not detected,
select class that does not override main class of FWaaS as main class of VPNaaS.

Change-Id: Ie1467743e332e8add2eeffed40b79959ae6aeda2
Closes-Bug: #1617268

iterators. We can use dict.items/keys instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.

commit_message:
py3:Rmove six.iteritems/iterkeys

1、As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems/keys achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items/keys instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2、In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I7e1943ec11f68054127451614822e7aa4b6281fc

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-06-21 13:46:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "Fixes get_devices_details_list... and update_device_list timeout

This patch fixes the issue with the batch RPC call
get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices() and update_device_list()
timing out in scaled up environments. This patch builds upon the
original patch by Ed Bak for resolving this issue.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163594/

The reviewers were unable to reach a consensus because of timeout vs
pagination arguments. Since the RPC timeout adjustment is already
implemented by Kevin Benton's patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/ to add exponential back off
with RPC clients, it made sense to resurrect this patch and add
dynamic division of devices list into subsets to avoid timeouts.

This patch retries the call till reaching a threshold total of 5 RPC
timeouts, dividing the chunk size by half for each retry.
The least chunk size is kept as 100.

There is a related patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284535/
but I believe this fix will hold good even with this one.

Change-Id: Id629e0a2ccc17c4fff3b19734e71bac95f66ae2f
Closes-Bug: #1430999
Related-bug: #1528895
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes get_devices_details_list... and update_device_list timeout

This patch fixes the issue with the batch RPC call
get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices() and update_device_list()
timing out in scaled up environments. This patch builds upon the
original patch by Ed Bak for resolving this issue.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163594/

The reviewers were unable to reach a consensus because of timeout vs
pagination arguments. Since the RPC timeout adjustment is already
implemented by Kevin Benton's patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/ to add exponential back off
with RPC clients, it made sense to resurrect this patch and add
dynamic division of devices list into subsets to avoid timeouts.

This patch retries the call till reaching a threshold total of 5 RPC
timeouts, dividing the chunk size by half for each retry.
The least chunk size is kept as 100.

There is a related patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284535/
but I believe this fix will hold good even with this one.

Change-Id: Id629e0a2ccc17c4fff3b19734e71bac95f66ae2f
Closes-Bug: #1430999
Related-bug: #1528895

commit_message:
DVR: Rename gateway variable in dvr_local_router to sn_port

While reviewing a patch I noticed there were some differences
in variable naming which might confuse the developers, so
renaming the variable 'gateway' to the appropriate name
'sn_port' so that it is in sync with all other variables.

Change-Id: I16d44362078f221da7dbdc6ee94140e2ec903686

commit_message:
[WIP] Use DATAPLANE events to notify l2pop

Use DATAPLANE events to notify mechanism drivers about port status
changes. This patch is to move postcommit notification from
update_port_status to dataplane events handler.

Change-Id: I8a72a98db0ab49079ca8099314a509d12c27950f

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-14 22:42:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/fullstack/resources/config.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "WIP: Switch fullstack tests to use rootwrap

WIP: I'm seeing these TRACES in the logs for various commands:
RuntimeError: Second simultaneous read on fileno 10 detected.
http://paste.openstack.org/show/490441/
I've also experienced tests that hang indefinitely, seemingly
not adhering to the global test timeout. Impressive!

Change-Id: I2ced7c7e22090286a743ba72f78d5f5c352b2f78
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Switch fullstack tests to use rootwrap

WIP: I'm seeing these TRACES in the logs for various commands:
RuntimeError: Second simultaneous read on fileno 10 detected.
http://paste.openstack.org/show/490441/
I've also experienced tests that hang indefinitely, seemingly
not adhering to the global test timeout. Impressive!

Change-Id: I2ced7c7e22090286a743ba72f78d5f5c352b2f78

can delete them in this patch.

commit_message:
Remove a remaining reference to mm-ctl

mm-ctl is used for MidoNet interface driver, which has been
moved to networking-midonet repository while ago.

networking-midonet's devstack plugin installs its own
rootwrap filters which covers mm-ctl. [1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/networking-midonet/blob/master/devstack/midonet_rootwrap.filters

Related-Bug: #1510826
Related-blueprint: core-vendor-decomposition
Change-Id: I9b23f282e6897a519e0426e83629b2802f8fcea7

commit_message:
Fix response codes of API ref

API reference sometimes mixes a normal response code and error codes.
This patch arranges these wrong codes.

Change-Id: I5cc4e978836d60b1930ea47996717826da56d283
Closes-Bug: #1611182

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-05-30 11:19:45.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': 'agent: dhcp: drop input from remote subnets

When connected to a public network, the DHCP agent would answer
recursive DNS queries coming from anywhere on the internet, which can be
used to amplify DDoS attacks.

This commit adds iptables rules that allow traffic coming from the
subnet to which the DHCP agent is connected, and drop everything else.

Closes-bug: 1501206
Change-Id: Ifc93a6f9ab8a553ba440e6284d08f6786131683a
'}]
commit_message:
agent: dhcp: drop input from remote subnets

When connected to a public network, the DHCP agent would answer
recursive DNS queries coming from anywhere on the internet, which can be
used to amplify DDoS attacks.

This commit adds iptables rules that allow traffic coming from the
subnet to which the DHCP agent is connected, and drop everything else.

Closes-bug: 1501206
Change-Id: Ifc93a6f9ab8a553ba440e6284d08f6786131683a

commit_message:
[wip]: add registry events for port dataplane wiring

This adds registry events for when the agent notifies the server
of dataplane activities (port finished wiring, port taken offline).
These events can be used by things like L2pop and DVR that need
to perform actions in reaction to these events. Previously they were
relying on overloading the update_port_status handler with a bunch
of logic unrelated to updating a ports status.

what was going wrong. There is some more context where originally
posted this test [1].

Basically, recording the IPs would get a FK constraint failure. We
suspected that it must be the port_id constraint because the network
and subnets have been committed to the DB by the time the constraint
was violated. But, I'm not sure why the port wouldn't be there. It was
already added to the transaction (but not committed).

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE Trying to figure out why this unit test fails

This was the way I originally wrote this unit test. I had to change it
because it would fail intermittently in the check queue. I was never
able to get it to fail locally though so it was difficult figure out
what was going wrong. There is some more context where originally
posted this test [1].

Basically, recording the IPs would get a FK constraint failure. We
suspected that it must be the port_id constraint because the network
and subnets have been committed to the DB by the time the constraint
was violated. But, I'm not sure why the port wouldn't be there. It was
already added to the transaction (but not committed).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/348956/7

Change-Id: I9d05520822b3740aadf72a312c28e5444bfc87fd

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-07 21:56:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/scenario/test_securitygroup.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/scenario/base.py'], 'message': '[RFC] scenario tests for security groups

Introduce scenario tests to test single security group in isolation. The
existing security group functional tests are limited to testing only
traffic which can be generate by ping and netcat, and this approach is
incompatible with SDN approaches like OVN. These tests use an isolated
network between two instances, one of which has port security disabled,
so only the effects of a single firewall are under tests. By using two
instances and the intervening network, firewall technologies which are
integrated with switching such as OVSFW can be tested.

Initially just testing the test setup.

Change-Id: Ifdd273d5e70651c0908e3f6ca6931142de1e7c5b
'}]
commit_message:
[RFC] scenario tests for security groups

Introduce scenario tests to test single security group in isolation. The
existing security group functional tests are limited to testing only
traffic which can be generate by ping and netcat, and this approach is
incompatible with SDN approaches like OVN. These tests use an isolated
network between two instances, one of which has port security disabled,
so only the effects of a single firewall are under tests. By using two
instances and the intervening network, firewall technologies which are
integrated with switching such as OVSFW can be tested.

Initially just testing the test setup.

Change-Id: Ifdd273d5e70651c0908e3f6ca6931142de1e7c5b

commit_message:
[WIP] Adding filters in get_subnets method call

This patch adds a filter enable_dhcp=True in get_subnets
method call and removes the conditional statement that
does the same.

Change-Id: I01fa869dc10a02b95fe5c433e710161a391d5380

commit_message:
[WIP] Adding Port Statistics to Neutron Metering Agent

Currently the Neutron Metering Agent only measures the bandwidth usage of the
Routers. The Neutron Metering Agent is extended to also support Port statistics
using the OpenvSwitch tools.

Change-Id: Idfd3091e9b9af80c3fdcc623f3fd6e1631d7e342
Closes-Bug: #1592918

subject: Make port-aggregation more efficient
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-08 02:43:52.000000000', 'files': ['networking_sfc/services/sfc/common/ovs_ext_lib.py', 'networking_sfc/tests/unit/services/sfc/common/test_ovs_ext_lib.py'], 'message': 'Make port-aggregation more efficient

Currently, get_port_mask takes O(n^2) to calculate port
aggregation list. This patch reduce the time complexity to O(n)
by first determine the boundary, and aggregate lower part and
upper part respectively. n refers to the bit number of port in the
above context.

Change-Id: I0887d7cc14f4496894df915dfe0ba1615e40c711
Closes-Bug: 1599037
'}]
commit_message:
Make port-aggregation more efficient

Currently, get_port_mask takes O(n^2) to calculate port
aggregation list. This patch reduce the time complexity to O(n)
by first determine the boundary, and aggregate lower part and
upper part respectively. n refers to the bit number of port in the
above context.

Change-Id: I0887d7cc14f4496894df915dfe0ba1615e40c711
Closes-Bug: 1599037

commit_message:
WIP: Remove unnecsary update_port_down rpc call in SR-IOV agent

When a port is deleted neutron server already updates the port
status to down, it is redundent to send an update status rpc
message from the SR-IOV agent's 'treat_devices_removed' method

commit_message:
[WIP] Unify the code path to create segment

Now there are 2 code path to create segment, they are [1], [2].
[1] will be called when the segment is reserved, while [2] will
reserve segment when execution.

This patch will unify the code path to one. This can avoid the duplicated
segment reserve issue.

[1] neutron.db.segments_db.add_network_segment
[2] neutron.services.segments.plugin.Plugin.create_segment

Change-Id: I8fd4e45f58131afde8a97f1a13a796d9ab81e445

commit_message:
Add an extension to get availability for subnetpools

This extension allows monitoring the availability of addresses within
a subnetpool through the API. For now, I'm just posting this for
comment. I modeled this a little after the network-ip availability
extension but I wonder if it would be better to just show this
information on the subnetpool resource.

Change-Id: If415b4b12a9b9b3ad9faafb1918ffb53e3f84338

subject: WIP: Serialize conflicting requests in task queue
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-08 04:47:58.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/CONTRACT_HEAD', 'networking_ovn/db/migration/alembic_migrations/script.py.mako', 'networking_ovn/db/migration/alembic_migrations/env.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/functional/base.py', 'networking_ovn/db/migration/alembic_migrations/README', 'networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_ml2_race.py', 'networking_ovn/db/db.py', 'networking_ovn/db/migration/__init__.py', 'networking_ovn/common/constants.py', 'networking_ovn/db/models.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/db/__init__.py', 'networking_ovn/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/EXPAND_HEAD', 'networking_ovn/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/contract/5e71ba4bf63b_initial_contract.py', 'networking_ovn/common/config.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/task_queue.py', 'networking_ovn/db/migration/alembic_migrations/__init__.py', 'networking_ovn/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/expand/c01a920585a6_add_ovn_task_queue.py', 'networking_ovn/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/expand/e10c1b12f18e_initial_expand.py', 'setup.cfg', 'networking_ovn/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/19a647f25c34_initial.py'], 'message': "WIP: Serialize conflicting requests in task queue

In ML2 mechanism driver, OVN updates are performed in post-commit,
which is after neutron DB transaction. With multi-workers/nodes,
the order of OVN updates are not guaranteed, which means the order
of OVN updates can be different from that of DB transaction commit
when there are racings between workers/nodes. This will result in
inconsistent data between OVN and Neutron DB.

This patch fixes the problem by serializing conflicting requests
in a task queue in DB. A place holder is marked in the queue in
precommit within the same DB transaction of the neutron DB change,
and during postcommit it checks and waits if there are conflicting
changes pending in the queue. This ensures ordering while keeping
the sync behaviour unchanged from client point of view, i.e. it
doesn't return until ovn nb operation complete.

TODO:
- Now only port-update is involved, other operations TBD
- Indirect dependency mentioned by bug #1611852 will be fixed in
a separate patch

Closes-bug: #1605089
Change-Id: If1a3a9e1841b7539a678a01182985cacb19d9dcc
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Serialize conflicting requests in task queue

In ML2 mechanism driver, OVN updates are performed in post-commit,
which is after neutron DB transaction. With multi-workers/nodes,
the order of OVN updates are not guaranteed, which means the order
of OVN updates can be different from that of DB transaction commit
when there are racings between workers/nodes. This will result in
inconsistent data between OVN and Neutron DB.

This patch fixes the problem by serializing conflicting requests
in a task queue in DB. A place holder is marked in the queue in
precommit within the same DB transaction of the neutron DB change,
and during postcommit it checks and waits if there are conflicting
changes pending in the queue. This ensures ordering while keeping
the sync behaviour unchanged from client point of view, i.e. it
doesn't return until ovn nb operation complete.

TODO:
- Now only port-update is involved, other operations TBD
- Indirect dependency mentioned by bug #1611852 will be fixed in
a separate patch

Closes-bug: #1605089
Change-Id: If1a3a9e1841b7539a678a01182985cacb19d9dcc

commit_message:
WIP: Fix address set adding & removing race condition

The fix is based on the task queue solution, with extra check
for ip changes in port data, to make sure addition of IP(s) is
not executed until pending deletions of same IP(s) on same
security-group(s) are completed.

TODO:
- This is RFC with port-updates changes only, port-create/delete TBD
- Add test cases (fix for race condition verified locally by adding
  sleep when deleting IPs from ports)

Closes-bug: #1611852
Change-Id: I88a97963af5a1810d5a6dd76df13524ef5e88625

This patch is changed for the plugin verification for OVN+VPN solution:
there is no router external ip any more, but instead use vpn gateway
external ip, more details can find in patch:

Update resource versions during agent update

We have more context on agent state change inside
AgentDBMixin._create_or_update_agent() so we can avoid
hackish modification of agent_state dict.

[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-09-14 14:23:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/services/segments/db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_segment.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_agents_db.py'], 'message': "Refactor agent state report handling on server side

Agent state reports processing on server may become a bottleneck at
scale so we should try to minimize the logic there.
This patch refactores agent state processing by getting diff
of current and new agent state and only processing what changed.
Previous agent state was fetched from db before this patch so we're
not introducing additional db query here.

Thus the patch simplifies the logic of updating segments to hosts
mappings: we only update if new bridge mappings reported by agent
differ from bridge mappings already stored in db.

Change-Id: I5d94cc7bf4e7f80187a06bc5ba75079e876ef5ce

commit_message:
Refactor agent state report handling on server side

Agent state reports processing on server may become a bottleneck at
scale so we should try to minimize the logic there.
This patch refactores agent state processing by getting diff
of current and new agent state and only processing what changed.
Previous agent state was fetched from db before this patch so we're
not introducing additional db query here.

Thus the patch simplifies the logic of updating segments to hosts
mappings: we only update if new bridge mappings reported by agent
differ from bridge mappings already stored in db.

Closes-Bug: #1573843
Change-Id: I5d94cc7bf4e7f80187a06bc5ba75079e876ef5ce

commit_message:
Fix KeyError on SIGTERM with native of_interface

The error appeared because AppManager.close() was
called twice, trying to uninstantiate apps that have
already been uninstantiated.
The patch solves the problem by calling app.stop()
instead of AppManager.close() in cleanup.

Change-Id: Ia823c97559d87e020fa91480e96a3768373064ef
Closes-Bug: #1589746

commit_message:
[WIP] Add scheduler support for VPN service.

As mentioned in specs https://review.openstack.org/#/c/334401/,
for VPN+OVN, VPNaaS needs a new scheduler. This patch adds support
for a VPN scheduler.

This patch depends on following the change:
I4b90288c9c04d0c45ddf4e69f80825a236721781

commit_message:
Add support for ingress bandwidth limit rules in ovs agent

Add openvswitch agent support for ingress bandwidth limiting.
It use default ovs QoS policies on bandwidth limiting mechanism.

DocImpact: Ingress bandwidth limit in QoS supported by Openvswitch agent

Co-Authored-By: Gal Sagie <gal.sagie@huawei.com>

Change-Id: If85516f07646e2858f38305c303cb3f7c7026e9c

commit_message:
[rally-jobs] use jinja variables

Before loading tasks as yaml/json, Rally processes them as jinja templates.
It means that we can move some hardcoded values to jinja variables.

Change-Id: I27402b54685d9366f1fb26a6ff0c337936a350f6

commit_message:
[rally-jobs] Increase number of tenants

The real cloud doesn't have only one tenant with one user in it, so let's
increase rally task to create at least 5 tenants(each iteration is launched
by random tenant by default)

Change-Id: Id28e87be3cb871a7ead5df915fea6a8563a9716d

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-24 08:36:01.000000000', 'files': ['rpm/networking-calico.spec', 'rpm/calico-dhcp-agent.service'], 'message': "Change user for calico-dhcp-agent

By default the calico dhcp agent want's to run as root.
A lot of trouble is avoided if the agent runs as the neutron user,
like the neutron dhcp agent. These changes accomplishes that by
changing the user in the systemd unit file and ensures that the
logging directory is present with correct permissions.

This creates a dependency to openstack-neutron-common, since
that package creates the neutron user and installs the
necessary rootwrap scripts.

Change-Id: Ie7124ab11d3ad3b94b8019caf45e7e95a7517545
"}]
commit_message:
Change user for calico-dhcp-agent

By default the calico dhcp agent want's to run as root.
A lot of trouble is avoided if the agent runs as the neutron user,
like the neutron dhcp agent. These changes accomplishes that by
changing the user in the systemd unit file and ensures that the
logging directory is present with correct permissions.

This creates a dependency to openstack-neutron-common, since
that package creates the neutron user and installs the
necessary rootwrap scripts.

Change-Id: Ie7124ab11d3ad3b94b8019caf45e7e95a7517545

commit_message:
Propagate revision_number bump to AMQP consumers

revision_number is bumped for networks on subnet update but this
change is not disseminated to the proper network resources. This
change explicitly calls update_network within update_subnet.

Change-Id: I31e646bc118e9e5b8397aa7ec3a19589648ee534
Closes-Bug: #1619253

commit_message:
Add fixed IPs to ns-dhcp

This adds fixed IPs corresponding to subnets without gateways to
ns-dhcp port on its creation. So that dnsmasq could get requests and
answer via that IP to instances when they look for DHCP server.

Change-Id: I4adbc1fa17b49d60b559966f7ccd29282352da3c
Closes-Bug: 1541490

commit_message:
Fixes the SNI issues in master(mitaka) for octavia

1. Fixes the mismatch between the tls_container_id lengths in neutron.lbaas_sni
and octavia.sni tables.
2. Fixes the syntax error in cert_parser.py field. (tls_container.id => tls_container_id)
3. Removes the certs['sni_certs'] parameter from the rest_api_driver.py as it gets wrongly
assigned to socket_path parameter in the jinja_cfg.py file.
4. Modifies the sample_configs to make the unit tests work with the above changes.

Change-Id: I8fe5854ef2dc508e37a368294c44eef63b5bccba
Closes-Bug: #1520990
(cherry picked from commit 298fd45380a937f21f09a4532615fe3af139ab56)

commit_message:
L3 HA: Track qr and qg interfaces in keepalived

Currently, keepalived configure file doesn't track "qr"
or "qg" interfaces. VIP will not changed if "qr" or "qg"
inteface was down.

This patch will track these interfaces in keepalive configure
file. So that VIP will changed if "qr" or "qg" interface was down

Change-Id: I223651ae962075fe94aa23ee0842a6156c018add
Closes-Bug: #1605966

commit_message:
Add bgpvpn and speaker binding

This patch include following changes:
1. Add 'vpns' as attribution of bgp speaker
2. Add extension/db/plugin support for bgpvpn & speaker binging CLIs
   neutron bgp-speaker-vpn-add BGP_SPEAKER BGPVPN
   neutron bgp-speaker-vpn-remove BGP_SPEAKER BGPVPN
3. Add bgpvpn installation scripts for tox
4. Add flag "bgpvpn_enabled" in neutron.conf to indicate whether
   networking-bgpvpn is installed

Co-Authored-By: ruansx@cn.ibm.com

Change-Id: I08174a5ff103f2b975272211ea32f46fb7fffed2
Partial-Bug: #1509431

Use case to solve: as an operator I want to expand or shrink Public
network without re-allocating all Floating IPs.

Generic approach is:

  1. Validate CIDR and gateway_ip. Regenerate allocation pools and
     gateway_ip for IPv6 PD if CIDR is changed.
  2. If new allocation pool is not provided, and old pool is not fit into
     CIDR, then fail. Same for new pool if provided.
  3. Re-allocate IP if they're out of new allocation pool.
  4. Notify routers that hold interfaces from Subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1605343
"}]
commit_message:
Update CIDR for subnet

Use case to solve: as an operator I want to expand or shrink Public
network without re-allocating all Floating IPs.

Generic approach is:

  1. Validate CIDR and gateway_ip. Regenerate allocation pools and
     gateway_ip for IPv6 PD if CIDR is changed.
  2. If new allocation pool is not provided, and old pool is not fit into
     CIDR, then fail. Same for new pool if provided.
  3. Re-allocate IP if they're out of new allocation pool.
  4. Notify routers that hold interfaces from Subnet.

Change-Id: I699815781198f92347b40330a0ca7d832fab7bb2
Closes-Bug: #1605343

commit_message:
Add some dhcp configuration options

This commit adds the following dhcp configuration options.
Such configurability helps to refactor the dhcp-agent to
be used only for metadata.

In Neutron
-------------

1) dhcp_rpc_callback
default:
"neutron.api.rpc.handlers.dhcp_rpc.DhcpRpcCallback"

2) dhcp_notifier
default:
"neutron.api.rpc.agentnotifiers.dhcp_rpc_agent_api.DhcpAgentNotifyAPI"

In DHCP Agent
-------------

3) dhcp_plugin_api
default:
"neutron.agent.dhcp.agent.DhcpPluginApi"

4) notifies_port_ready
default: True

Change-Id: If88e75d2f4b197c12a8618537b7169f9b6546989
Closes-Bug: 1611119

commit_message:

The '-C' option is not available in the default git version
on CentOS.

commit_message:
Enable Neutron for mutable-config

For an overview, see:

    http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.config/mutable.html

There are a few immediate benefits to doing this. 1) option
DEFAULT:debug becomes mutable; 2) log_config_append becomes mutable;
3) Neutron can make more options mutable as desired.

bp mutable-config-ocata

Change-Id: I53c3108c1fc923f1b00aecf6ea0116eae1b9597d

commit_message:
Set segments plugin as default

Before routed network, functions in [1] are used to manage
network segment. Routed network introduces a plugin [2] to manage
network segment. So, now there are 2 code paths to do the same job.
Except in ml2, the segments plugin will be used to manage network
segments.

Patch [3] [4] will make ml2 use segments plugin to create/delete segments.
This makes code simple and fixes the conflict issue mentioned in [4].
Since ml2 always uses segments, it brings the requirement to make segments
plugin always be available.

This patch sets the segments plugin as a default service plugin and
removes the code that checks if segments plugin is loaded.

[1] neutron.db.segments_db
[2] neutron.services.segments.plugin
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317358/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/359147/

Change-Id: I535452ee8fb540e019393c6e570b321c3ad4ae0d

commit_message:
Fix serializer with None

Some neutron POST and PUT APIs don't return response body
but the JSONDictSerializer doesn't expect the None is passed.
This patch add a check for None into serializer.

Depends-On: Ia772927a28cb83c4c88680b5add925b12978dc5d
Change-Id: I6ee5f88ee518551f75416620750e0564945a42f8
Closes-Bug: #1555921
