[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-30 19:41:39.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/bgp-evpn-advertisement.rst'], 'message': 'Add BGP EVPN IP Prefix Advertisement support to Neutron Dynamic Routing

This spec proposes to advertise OpenStack tenant networks to upstream
(physical) routers running VPNs. The control plane uses BGP EVPN IP
Prefix Advertisement to advertise routes in the context of a typically
tenant-specific VPN. The corresponding data plane uses VXLAN on the
networks connecting OpenStack routers to upstream routers.

Co-Authored-By: Siddanagouda Khot <siddanmk@yahoo.co.in>

commit_message:
Add BGP EVPN IP Prefix Advertisement support to Neutron Dynamic Routing

This spec proposes to advertise OpenStack tenant networks to upstream
(physical) routers running VPNs. The control plane uses BGP EVPN IP
Prefix Advertisement to advertise routes in the context of a typically
tenant-specific VPN. The corresponding data plane uses VXLAN on the
networks connecting OpenStack routers to upstream routers.

Change-Id: I78790f336b8531cc83e32076d395dce9615ee16e
Co-Authored-By: Siddanagouda Khot <siddanmk@yahoo.co.in>
Related-Bug: #1509431

commit_message:
Don't include [agent] section in neutron.conf.sample

neutron-server does not need options from the [agent] section so remove
this section from the neutron.conf.sample config file.

Change-Id: I589c8c67415d2e5d0550251e6175987a3aa90633
Closes-Bug: #1620211

commit_message:
Add config option for L3 address scope

In general, we may not use address scope function, but IPtables
rules for address scope always initialized and processed in router
update.

We can add a config option for address scope, IPtables rules for
address scope will not handle if we disable address scope.

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: Ie8ec19f9062e562a9e15533e78c316e4c4d6e19f
Closes-Bug: #1613642

commit_message:
Allow deletion of ERRORed load balancers

The API was not allowing the deletion of load balancers in ERROR state.
Users should be able to delete their load balancers in ACTIVE or ERROR
state.  This is good for users and good for operators.

Closes-Bug: #1607502

Conflicts:
	octavia/tests/functional/db/test_repositories.py

Change-Id: If1587e25d5f79c136d3aec4e129a8227dddbce3f

commit_message:
Allow easy configuration of host/port settings

The monascastatsd client allowed the host and port to be set but only if you
constructed a Connection object yourself.  This allows you just to specify
host and port when constructing the client object.

Change-Id: Ib49e261b915c07bf8f7036164f1e4814d80ecc1f

dogtag imports pki so mention it as requirement. python-nss
is needed by dogtag-pki.
Also add a bindep.txt file which is used by bindep to install system
packages.
To install python-nss via pip, header files from nss-devel and
mozilla-nss-devel are needed.

Change-Id: Ia3276ad4be56d40fddbf458f215ab93e44ed6907

Closes-Bug: #1604417
'}]
commit_message:
Add dogtag-pki and python-nss as extra requirement

dogtag imports pki so mention it as requirement. python-nss
is needed by dogtag-pki.
Also add a bindep.txt file which is used by bindep to install system
packages.
To install python-nss via pip, header files from nss-devel and
mozilla-nss-devel are needed.

Change-Id: Ia3276ad4be56d40fddbf458f215ab93e44ed6907
Depends-On: Ibedae54e631e9c3d3726453adcd204ce96b19d77
Closes-Bug: #1604417

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 05:48:38.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/roles/compute.pp'], 'message': 'Add login shell for user nova on Centos for live migration

To live migrate, user nova has to ssh to another compute node, so user
nova should have a login shell, but rpm install process creates user
nova does not have a login shell.
[root@node-52 ~]# cat /etc/passwd | grep nova
nova:x:162:162:OpenStack Nova Daemons:/var/lib/nova:/sbin/nologin

Change-Id: I4ee987a28378300dbbad296de52a807c1436b56e
'}]
commit_message:
Add login shell for user nova on Centos for live migration

To live migrate, user nova has to ssh to another compute node, so user
nova should have a login shell, but rpm install process creates user
nova does not have a login shell.
[root@node-52 ~]# cat /etc/passwd | grep nova
nova:x:162:162:OpenStack Nova Daemons:/var/lib/nova:/sbin/nologin

Change-Id: I4ee987a28378300dbbad296de52a807c1436b56e

commit_message:
Remove the Stress framework

It's not used anymore. There was general consensus in Feb 2016
to deprecate it (see [1]) and remove it in Newton.

[1]  [qa] deprecating Tempest stress framework

Change-Id: Ib229985ea2a1fee495c9492c9ce1781e6bac1dc6

commit_message:
Update description of CP in VNFD Template Guide

Descripton of Connection Point needs to be updated to keep
consistency with tacker_nfv_defs.yaml.
Currently 'type' is an optional property and has a constraint.
Also 'security_groups' property was introduced in [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/334256/

Change-Id: Ic0721c3914197bdc7128b5fff76783a2f7ba9f9e

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-09 12:34:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vm.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/fixtures.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vm.py'], 'message': 'WIP: PowerVM: Implement get_instance_diagnostics

This adds the implementation for get_instance_diagnostics method.

With nova-powervm, as opposed to the other drivers, the disk details in
the instance diagnostics actually refer to the storage adapter details.
That is because, we put many disks on a given storage bus. And because
of that, we can only get the diagnostics for the storage bus.

Change-Id: I7e509b8247b8133529acff5ef10f9341e62f0c93
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: PowerVM: Implement get_instance_diagnostics

This adds the implementation for get_instance_diagnostics method.

With nova-powervm, as opposed to the other drivers, the disk details in
the instance diagnostics actually refer to the storage adapter details.
That is because, we put many disks on a given storage bus. And because
of that, we can only get the diagnostics for the storage bus.

Change-Id: I7e509b8247b8133529acff5ef10f9341e62f0c93

commit_message:
Pecan: rework notifier hook for registry callbacks

[1] and [2] were added to use the registry callback notifier for dhcp and nova
notifications for the legacy wsgi layer.  This adds the same functionality
to the pecan wsgi layer.  It just so happens to clean the code up nicely
and also fixes a bug that was introduced by [3] that caused an ever
increasing number of subscriptions to the registry callback notifier.

[1] I7440becb6d30af7159ecaeba09d7a28eceb71bea
[2] I1d7d4b80ee77deefce18df22f76cab81750c0397
[3] I607635601caff0322fd0c80c9023f5c4f663ca25

Change-Id: I0a8b64e7742283a9d6c6b42ebc27887836df69ec
Closes-Bug: #1633296

commit_message:
Catch the integrityError when update firewall group with non exist port

When create/update firewall group should verify the port_id exist in
current system.

This patch add check in update firewall group operation to verify
the input ports are exist.

Change-Id: I98862ff46eb80b5f516dd02a0ab179017825a9c9
Closes-Bug: #1634086

commit_message:
[install] Fix the incorrect flavor name

There is no flavor named "m1.tiny". Actually, "m1.nano" is created
to be used to create CirrOS server. The patch fixes it.

Closes-Bug: #1635465

subject: VMware: Add notes about setting vmdk UUID
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 10:39:51.000000000', 'files': ['doc/config-reference/source/block-storage/drivers/vmware-vmdk-driver.rst'], 'message': 'VMware: Add notes about setting vmdk UUID

The VMDK driver does not set the vmdk UUID to volume UUID
if the volume is created as a linked clone of the source
volume or snapshot. Adding notes to the driver config to
document this limitation.

Change-Id: I94860644ab7b6257f99911c88b584137887d2f74
Closes-bug: #1630422
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Add notes about setting vmdk UUID

The VMDK driver does not set the vmdk UUID to volume UUID
if the volume is created as a linked clone of the source
volume or snapshot. Adding notes to the driver config to
document this limitation.

Change-Id: I94860644ab7b6257f99911c88b584137887d2f74
Closes-bug: #1630422

commit_message:
Pass sudo parameter to shotgun

The parameter specifies whether to use sudo to
execute a command or fetch a file. By default it
is false, however, it is set to true for commands
or files, which require elevated privileges.

Change-Id: Ide0201c4c58f415d1fbcd05230d179a55d575cbe
Blueprint: fuel-nonroot-openstack-nodes
Co-Authored-By: Omar Rivera <gr113x@att.com>

commit_message:
Use "ssh-user" and "sudo" parameters from Nailgun

Use a setting from Nailgun as SSH login for slave node connections
instead of root SSH. Also use "sudo" parameter from Nailgun to
use sudo for fabric calls or not.

Change-Id: Ib9d938f3813c6a9f07f6efa1cb92282dd7ed53fa
Blueprint: fuel-nonroot-openstack-nodes

commit_message:

documentation to neutron-lib/api-ref. I'm creating it first under
the networking-bgpvpn repo in order to iron out the issues.

commit_message:
Fix E128 pep8 errors in tacker server

This Patch fixes pep8 errors and enables this tests for all new patches
to tacker.

E128 continuation line under indented for visual indent

see OpenStack Style Guidelines
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/

Change-Id: I85443570baa3309a177b5d51085730f762664294

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 06:15:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_floating_ips.py'], 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I19fe70118f0478e2fd4cbcb749cdaf0d05140f3d
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I19fe70118f0478e2fd4cbcb749cdaf0d05140f3d

commit_message:
Fix typos vc_ca_file -> vcenter_ca_file

Update vmware_attributes_metadata in releases table.

Some changes were made in vmware_attributes_metadata
since 9.0 in openstack.yaml so we have to update releases
table accordingly during upgrade.

CA file is not uploaded because we made a mistake
in name vc_ca_file.

Fix typos vc_ca_file -> vcenter_ca_file to get correct
certificate files for cinder and compute item in
orchestrator serializer.

Change-Id: I5eba8a27fe20017b749a529d2847452b29588b5a
Closes-Bug: #1624358
Partial-Bug: #1618481
Partial-Bug: #1616549

subject: Not appropriate name sg rule attribute
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-24 02:40:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/unit/network/v2/test_security_group_rule.py', 'doc/source/command-objects/security-group-rule.rst', 'openstackclient/network/v2/security_group_rule.py'], 'message': 'Not appropriate name sg rule attribute

For ingress rules set ip-prefix means src-ip-
prefix, but for egress rules set ip-prefix means
dst-ip-prefix. It is not appropriate to name
src-ip directly. So as to src-group, dst-port.

Change-Id: I03fd0e14e470e7272930ac2651e73263b83bd4e1
'}]
commit_message:
Not appropriate name sg rule attribute

For ingress rules set ip-prefix means src-ip-
prefix, but for egress rules set ip-prefix means
dst-ip-prefix. It is not appropriate to name
src-ip directly. So as to src-group, dst-port.

Change-Id: I03fd0e14e470e7272930ac2651e73263b83bd4e1

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-10-24 03:31:54.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/multi-region.rst'], 'message': 'Multi-Region Support

A proposal for implementing multiple region support by
simply allocating instances in different regions using
the existing --os-region-name support.  Includes support
for allocating instances in multiple regions for replication
and clustering.  Support for restoring backups to
different regions will also be included.

APIImpact

Implements Blueprint: bp/multi-region

Change-Id: I6270310716944272651d6ac62bdd3e41e056f975
'}]
commit_message:
Multi-Region Support

A proposal for implementing multiple region support by
simply allocating instances in different regions using
the existing --os-region-name support.  Includes support
for allocating instances in multiple regions for replication
and clustering.  Support for restoring backups to
different regions will also be included.

APIImpact

Implements Blueprint: bp/multi-region

Change-Id: I6270310716944272651d6ac62bdd3e41e056f975

subject: Update ``updated_at`` field on image member change
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-23 17:14:51.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/glance/lite-specs.rst'], 'message': "Update ``updated_at`` field on image member change

Currently, when an image member is added, removed, or altered, the image
``updated_at`` timestamp doesn't change. This is causing a problem for
Searchlight project, which relies on the timestamp to process out of order
notifications. This spec proposes to add functionality to update the timestamp
for image member changes.

Change-Id: I474f283d39e89530d5dc6a50ea1cc070959601db
"}]
commit_message:
Update ``updated_at`` field on image member change

Currently, when an image member is added, removed, or altered, the image
``updated_at`` timestamp doesn't change. This is causing a problem for
Searchlight project, which relies on the timestamp to process out of order
notifications. This spec proposes to add functionality to update the timestamp
for image member changes.

Change-Id: I474f283d39e89530d5dc6a50ea1cc070959601db

subject: Merge the separated link lines on image client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 02:58:54.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/services/image/v2/namespaces_client.py'], 'message': 'Merge the separated link lines on image client

On current docstring of service clients, every link to API
reference is separated to 2 lines. That is unreadable on the
code and the documentation which is created from the docstring
also will be unreadablebecause of the separated link lines.

This patch merges the separated lines into a single line for the
readability.

Change-Id: I1d227163dd21706583a0b771e2e6638b70804f05
'}]
commit_message:
Merge the separated link lines on image client

On current docstring of service clients, every link to API
reference is separated to 2 lines. That is unreadable on the
code and the documentation which is created from the docstring
also will be unreadablebecause of the separated link lines.

This patch merges the separated lines into a single line for the
readability.

Change-Id: I1d227163dd21706583a0b771e2e6638b70804f05

commit_message:
Overrides get_supported_power_states() for WOL Power

This patch overrides the default implementation of
get_supported_power_states() in the base power I/F for WOL Power.
The get_supported_power_states() is newly introduced in the base power
I/F to support SOFT_REBOOT and SOFT_POWER_OFF functions.

Partial-Bug: #1526226
Change-Id: I2be768379901cbd7a546fd85eeebd2a12ac0ce54

commit_message:
Add the groundwork for replacing python-*client

Using the previous addition os Session task manager, this adds functions
to munchify results, pull out the top level dict and throw execptions
that are consistent with what we've been throwing (except a bit better)

There are two commented out lines that show doing the change to
list_servers. I promise they work - but I didn't feel like fixing
unittests yet.

subject: Make munch_response smarter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-16 14:33:32.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Make munch_response smarter

In 100% of the cases so far, the return structure is a dict with a
single key inside of which the actual data is held. That's neat - it
means we don't need to pass the key name.

Also, remove the json decode error fallback. It turns out all of the
subsequent code assumes that the json decoding worked, so returning text
instead of json - not particularly helpful.

Change-Id: I665b45ff7139a432f4fcc91588f7d5c93806b92e
"}]
commit_message:
Make munch_response smarter

In 100% of the cases so far, the return structure is a dict with a
single key inside of which the actual data is held. That's neat - it
means we don't need to pass the key name.

Also, remove the json decode error fallback. It turns out all of the
subsequent code assumes that the json decoding worked, so returning text
instead of json - not particularly helpful.

Change-Id: I665b45ff7139a432f4fcc91588f7d5c93806b92e

like to betamax the functional tests - as we put in REST calls, let's

Change-Id: Ife4d95df5417d329195c737814e89d1370a0597b
"}]
commit_message:
Start using requests-mock for REST unit tests

Mocking out the whole client is the wrong level. Although we'd still
like to betamax the functional tests - as we put in REST calls, let's
make the mocking of them happen at the requests level so that we test as
much of shade as we can.

Change-Id: Ife4d95df5417d329195c737814e89d1370a0597b

subject: Create and use a Session wrapper for REST in TaskManager
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-16 14:33:32.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'shade/_session.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Create and use a Session wrapper for REST in TaskManager

Adding a TaskManager aware wrapper around Session gets us reporting of
keystone token calls. It'll also make it easier to do direct REST calls
instead of the python-*clients - but getting logging/rate limiting to
include keystone token related calls is good. Also, it'll make the
glance 'use iterators' approach work right ... and should also mean
using openstacksdk should work, should we want to go that route.

NOTE: This will cause most of the tasks to be double-tasked because the
Task will go to the TaskManager and then the underlying REST call will
go to TaskManager. We should not release this to prod for nodepool until
the Tasks have been converted.

Change-Id: If2d42af5fde1334b3b99ec3a9bbade38b19adbee
"}]
commit_message:
Create and use a Session wrapper for REST in TaskManager

Adding a TaskManager aware wrapper around Session gets us reporting of
keystone token calls. It'll also make it easier to do direct REST calls
instead of the python-*clients - but getting logging/rate limiting to
include keystone token related calls is good. Also, it'll make the
glance 'use iterators' approach work right ... and should also mean
using openstacksdk should work, should we want to go that route.

NOTE: This will cause most of the tasks to be double-tasked because the
Task will go to the TaskManager and then the underlying REST call will
go to TaskManager. We should not release this to prod for nodepool until
the Tasks have been converted.

Change-Id: If2d42af5fde1334b3b99ec3a9bbade38b19adbee

subject: Add missed requirement of keystoneauth1
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-21 03:34:53.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add missed requirement of keystoneauth1

This patch adds missed requirement of keystoneauth1 to
requirement list. keystoneauth1.loading module is required

commit_message:
Add missed requirement of keystoneauth1

This patch adds missed requirement of keystoneauth1 to
requirement list. keystoneauth1.loading module is required
to load zaqar related config options for message receiver.

Change-Id: I1c540ee4acd1f84ff97fd7796687fd54526b4649

commit_message:
fix ceph config file path variable

CEPH_CONF does not exist anymore, resulting both cinder-volume and
cinder-backup being configured with an empty rbd_ceph_conf option.
Using CEPH_CONF_FILE to fix this.

Change-Id: I1aa590aba900a4a94698917e45a0ea5c6f497f18
Signed-off-by: Sébastien Han <seb@redhat.com>

subject: Keep all the wrapping in the Adapter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-23 22:29:41.000000000', 'files': ['shade/_adapter.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Keep all the wrapping in the Adapter

The idea of using a Session wrapper to deal with TaskManager is cool.
However, it blocks landing this stuff because of Nodepool due to nested
calls getting double-submitted to TaskManager and blockig when there is
a TaskManager like nodepool uses.

If we put it all in the Adapter, then only the direct REST calls get
submitted automagically to the TaskManager, and the REST calls generated
by the client libs do not. This should make the stack safe to land.

Change-Id: I633eaafbe7831922797de84af593a8d9df5e8d9a
'}]
commit_message:
Keep all the wrapping in the Adapter

The idea of using a Session wrapper to deal with TaskManager is cool.
However, it blocks landing this stuff because of Nodepool due to nested
calls getting double-submitted to TaskManager and blockig when there is
a TaskManager like nodepool uses.

If we put it all in the Adapter, then only the direct REST calls get
submitted automagically to the TaskManager, and the REST calls generated
by the client libs do not. This should make the stack safe to land.

Change-Id: I633eaafbe7831922797de84af593a8d9df5e8d9a

commit_message:
Add missing compat routine for Usage object

We added a v1.1 to Usage without a compat routine to go with it. It's not really
a big deal as we're not sending this over RPC anywhere yet that I know of, but
we should have this for the sake of completeness.

Change-Id: Ia50448741b29e1c33e4988a9476418b6ba835983

subject: Image cleanup is missing in test_create_delete_image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 07:41:01.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/images/test_images_oneserver.py'], 'message': 'Image cleanup is missing in test_create_delete_image

In test_create_delete_image, there is no addCleanup after
self.client.create_image, so if anything goes wrong, the
following self.client.delete_image may not be executed and
the image will be left over improperly. This is to fix it.

Change-Id: Ib54758c0d29efd4f49d470a665713878c0576f10
'}]
commit_message:
Image cleanup is missing in test_create_delete_image

In test_create_delete_image, there is no addCleanup after
self.client.create_image, so if anything goes wrong, the
following self.client.delete_image may not be executed and
the image will be left over improperly. This is to fix it.

Change-Id: Ib54758c0d29efd4f49d470a665713878c0576f10

subject: Add post-finalise phase (outside chroot)
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-23 09:48:09.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'doc/source/developer/developing_elements.rst', 'bin/dib-lint'], 'message': 'Add post-finalise phase (outside chroot)

As a DIB user, I sometimes want to do something to the chroot
filesystem, before we save and compress the image.  This avoids the
need to run something like virt-customize on a compressed image.

A example would be to run ansible-playbook on the build host, using
the connection chroot interface to do configuration management to the
chroot.

Change-Id: If7f15e1c1a274c477c6a5c418d6a2de03f24b461
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add post-finalise phase (outside chroot)

As a DIB user, I sometimes want to do something to the chroot
filesystem, before we save and compress the image.  This avoids the
need to run something like virt-customize on a compressed image.

A example would be to run ansible-playbook on the build host, using
the connection chroot interface to do configuration management to the
chroot.

Change-Id: If7f15e1c1a274c477c6a5c418d6a2de03f24b461
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate iscsi_ip_address, as it is not used

The EMC VNX volume drivers does not use iscsi_ip_address for
anything.

The iscsi_ip_address parameter is deprecated, has no effect
and will be removed in future release.

Change-Id: Ib8705171c4750d2039ff97a616eae9f309db08a0

subject: Manage package created apache config file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 20:02:05.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/fix_existing_wsgi_conf_from_packaging-f407b04e30ee44e2.yaml', 'manifests/params.pp', 'spec/classes/barbican_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Manage package created apache config file

The Ubuntu Cloud Archive barbican-api package deposits a config file in
/etc/apache2/conf-enable, and then enables it. This configuration has a
duplicate definition for the WSGI process that is used by puppet. This
will cause apache to not start, or reload. The new behavior is to modify
the package deposited file of the new file names, as a comment like done
with the puppet-horizon package. RedHat family was added for parity.

Change-Id: I5c857a342000d04fe87c314c12bded78975d0c97
Closes-Bug: 1633850
(cherry picked from commit 25f2899ef866253face0cdd51604951b135fb52e)
'}]
commit_message:
Manage package created apache config file

The Ubuntu Cloud Archive barbican-api package deposits a config file in
/etc/apache2/conf-enable, and then enables it. This configuration has a
duplicate definition for the WSGI process that is used by puppet. This
will cause apache to not start, or reload. The new behavior is to modify
the package deposited file of the new file names, as a comment like done
with the puppet-horizon package. RedHat family was added for parity.

Change-Id: I5c857a342000d04fe87c314c12bded78975d0c97
Closes-Bug: 1633850
(cherry picked from commit 25f2899ef866253face0cdd51604951b135fb52e)

commit_message:
Switch Ironic to use local boot by default for all nodes

This finally puts an end to messing with node capabilities for enabling local
boot. This change makes local boot the default for all nodes, unless netboot
is requested explicitly.

Change-Id: Ide2e4af4746e08aa8f65be491ff93135d2902044
Related-Bug: #1619339

subject: Install, enable docker service
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-21 21:51:44.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'message': 'Install, enable docker service

This change installs and enables the docker service when
enable_docker_registry=true. This will allow the undercloud docker
registry to be populated with images that are built on the undercloud
or pulled from other registries.

The docker service runs on a local socket so there are no networking
concerns with enabling the service.

A dormant docker service takes about 500MB of memory, so enabling it
should have minimal impact on the undercloud memory use.

Change-Id: I22854dfa735027d7916bc0090432b66250f7780f
'}]
commit_message:
Install, enable docker service

This change installs and enables the docker service when
enable_docker_registry=true. This will allow the undercloud docker
registry to be populated with images that are built on the undercloud
or pulled from other registries.

The docker service runs on a local socket so there are no networking
concerns with enabling the service.

A dormant docker service takes about 500MB of memory, so enabling it
should have minimal impact on the undercloud memory use.

Change-Id: I22854dfa735027d7916bc0090432b66250f7780f

This binds docker-registry to the proper IP address instead of the

undercloud reboot.

Change-Id: If12195d657b87b566049541832e1048d90e6c240
'}]
commit_message:
Bind docker-registry to controller_host

This binds docker-registry to the proper IP address instead of the
default 0.0.0.0, and also enables the service so that it restarts on
undercloud reboot.

Change-Id: If12195d657b87b566049541832e1048d90e6c240

commit_message:
Added list of packages to provision info

Provision info already contains list of packages as
string, but fa_builder expects list and conversion from
string to list was done by using yaql expression.
This patch moves this conversion to nailgun side.

Change-Id: I1ad44b7f2e69edbb8b8e28fd7840010af2594cd7
Closes-Bug: 1630275

Deprecate the Cinder v2 API

This patch deprecates the Cinder v2 API and sets up a warning message 
for the operators if they have enabled it.

Change-Id: Ibdeb767d6dfa86ef64ff2740331789e28e560479

commit_message:
Handle API Invalid_UUID exception at WSGI level

This patch changes current behavior and removes the exception
handling to the operation so that those exceptions can be
handled at the WSGI level.

Change-Id: I17e9f08c364eed5538564f838d253e626090606c

commit_message:
Fix FD leak in storlet_gateway

storlet_gateway leaks the FD of "input_data_read_fd" in PUT request.
This patch prevent to leak the FD of "input_data_read_fd".

Change-Id: Ic61049e18f450ec3b0b0e7bae9d55b889f80baf3
Closes-Bug: #1634721

commit_message:
Define image status enums for compute proxy API schema

The compute images API proxy defines enums for the image
status values so we should enforce those in the response
schema validation.

Note that this is used in refstack/defcore tests.

Change-Id: I8c95c567eb8bb36a219e90ed811c09a7ead07771

commit_message:
Test case with list-instance-actions for deleted server

In accordance with [1], we can use the 'nova instance-action-list'
command to list actions on a deleted server. To do this, UUID of
a server must be used, and API microversions  ‘2.21’ - ‘2.latest’
must be supported [2].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/nova.html
[2] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html
    #os-instance-actions-v2.1

Change-Id: I3b7d99321bb7f931e45b15b5c5d1ec3a7b7b7169

commit_message:
Retire neutron-pd-driver

As anticipated in [1] and communicated in [2], it is time
this project be retired. This is communicated once more in
[3]. The ACL change is required to take ownership of
retirement step [4], in case the pd-driver core team is
not responsive.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/312199/5/specs/newton/neutron-stadium.rst@291
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-September/104671.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/106112.html
[4] I2b44230be9b5d7395de35a0113e8641973abead9

Change-Id: I77099ba826b8c7d28379a823b4dc74aa65e653d8

subject: Fix issue with not removing rbd rescue disk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 11:49:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/storage/test_rbd.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/storage/rbd_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix issue with not removing rbd rescue disk

Currently when instance that use RBD as backend
is rescued and next unrescued, rescue image is
not removed, this cause issue when the same
instance is rescued again it's use old rescue
image not new one.

Change-Id: Idf4086303baa4b936c90be89552ad8deb45cef3a
Closes-Bug: #1475652
(cherry picked from commit c12d388070895e40be19f4f4e5fded736a5376be)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with not removing rbd rescue disk

Currently when instance that use RBD as backend
is rescued and next unrescued, rescue image is
not removed, this cause issue when the same
instance is rescued again it's use old rescue
image not new one.

Change-Id: Idf4086303baa4b936c90be89552ad8deb45cef3a
Closes-Bug: #1475652
(cherry picked from commit c12d388070895e40be19f4f4e5fded736a5376be)

subject: Fix the rabbitmq/redis pacemaker resource timeouts on updates
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-22 20:59:16.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': 'Fix the rabbitmq/redis pacemaker resource timeouts on updates

With the following two changes we increased the timeout for redis and
rabbit for both starting and stopping to 200s:
https://review.openstack.org/386618 newton (merged)
https://review.openstack.org/385555 master (merged)

We want to also fix that on minor updates on all our supported
releases upstream and downstream (newton, mitaka, liberty, kilo).
This way we can guarantee that we have a uniform timeout for
sart and stop for rabbit and redis across all our releases.

Change-Id: If59bf3386832ee78d3a654f01077aff2e8be76e8
Closes-Bug: #1634851
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the rabbitmq/redis pacemaker resource timeouts on updates

With the following two changes we increased the timeout for redis and
rabbit for both starting and stopping to 200s:
https://review.openstack.org/386618 newton (merged)
https://review.openstack.org/385555 master (merged)

We want to also fix that on minor updates on all our supported
releases upstream and downstream (newton, mitaka, liberty, kilo).
This way we can guarantee that we have a uniform timeout for
sart and stop for rabbit and redis across all our releases.

Change-Id: If59bf3386832ee78d3a654f01077aff2e8be76e8
Closes-Bug: #1634851

subject: Enable haproxy statistics unix socket
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-16 19:59:12.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': 'Enable haproxy statistics unix socket

By enabling the statistics socket we allow the collection
of statistics over time for haproxy.

This socket is set to "user" level, so this socket is limited
to read-only. The "stats timeout" line is optional, but since the
default timeout of the stats socket is 10s, we set this higher.

Change-Id: I22d3ab771e981be0d2c74b60443d276973bc1639
'}]
commit_message:
Enable haproxy statistics unix socket

By enabling the statistics socket we allow the collection
of statistics over time for haproxy.

This socket is set to "user" level, so this socket is limited
to read-only. The "stats timeout" line is optional, but since the
default timeout of the stats socket is 10s, we set this higher.

Change-Id: I22d3ab771e981be0d2c74b60443d276973bc1639

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 20:00:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/conductor/__init__.py', 'nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/cmd/compute.py', 'nova/cmd/network.py'], 'message': 'Stop honoring conductor use_local flag

In order to remove local conductor mode, many refactors (mostly
in the tests) will need to happen. This makes a first stab at
that, which renders the flag itself ineffective at changing the
startup behavior of the compute and network services. Subsequent
patches will work to remove dependence on the flag in the tests,
which will allow removal of the flag entirely.

This introduces a temporary measure whereby we default the
conductor API to always local, unless overridden by the
conductor.force_remote() call. This is made in the relevant
service startups, and anywhere in the tests that we need
to assume a conductor over RPC. We can remove that once we
drop the dependence in the tests, which will then allow us
to explicitly install the remote conductor at service startup,
eliminating the need for the flag.

Change-Id: Id7755f1a80356364a2ff0498c0905b46432a88f1
'}]
commit_message:
Stop honoring conductor use_local flag

In order to remove local conductor mode, many refactors (mostly
in the tests) will need to happen. This makes a first stab at
that, which renders the flag itself ineffective at changing the
startup behavior of the compute and network services. Subsequent
patches will work to remove dependence on the flag in the tests,
which will allow removal of the flag entirely.

This introduces a temporary measure whereby we default the
conductor API to always local, unless overridden by the
conductor.force_remote() call. This is made in the relevant
service startups, and anywhere in the tests that we need
to assume a conductor over RPC. We can remove that once we
drop the dependence in the tests, which will then allow us
to explicitly install the remote conductor at service startup,
eliminating the need for the flag.

Change-Id: Id7755f1a80356364a2ff0498c0905b46432a88f1

subject: Add _error_checker() call on versions_client
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 9725, 'name': 'Dong Ma', 'email': 'winterma.dong@gmail.com', 'username': 'larainema'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-20 21:26:53.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/services/network/versions_client.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-error-code-translation-to-versions-clients-acbc78292e24b014.yaml', 'tempest/lib/services/compute/versions_client.py'], 'message': "Add _error_checker() call on versions_client

There are two REST API operation methods (request and raw_request)
under tempest.lib and most service clients use request().
request() calls _error_checker() for translating HTTP error code to
the corresponding exception, however raw_request() doesn't do that
because of the raw method.
When an exception happens on service client methods which calls
raw_request(), now Tempest cannot translated and it makes some
unexpected situation like I6c05ad377847e2b67ab988efdba006f73cbafcfe

This patch adds _error_checker() call to them.

Change-Id: I9acf45eb1711683b47f0606ed7c1a9c8327ef241
"}]
commit_message:
Add _error_checker() call on versions_client

There are two REST API operation methods (request and raw_request)
under tempest.lib and most service clients use request().
request() calls _error_checker() for translating HTTP error code to
the corresponding exception, however raw_request() doesn't do that
because of the raw method.
When an exception happens on service client methods which calls
raw_request(), now Tempest cannot translated and it makes some
unexpected situation like I6c05ad377847e2b67ab988efdba006f73cbafcfe

This patch adds _error_checker() call to them.

Change-Id: I9acf45eb1711683b47f0606ed7c1a9c8327ef241

which checks category in packages details instead of checking
category count.

'Delete category' button is always displayed with GLARE and this

commit_message:
Fix js validation of the password in dynamic UI

Before this patch clicking on an eye icon disabled javascript
validation of the password. I added to password field
the attribute 'data-type=password' and in js changed
the selector to include new attribute in the selector,
that attaches the check function.

Change-Id: Ic7e57814a68c315e570c120f31febdada73079a7
Closes-Bug: #1567859
(cherry picked from commit d50cb35ece120b97a0c309d84dd2708c8c35c3ab)

commit_message:
Use sys.maxsize instead of sys.maxint

The sys.maxint constant was removed in python 3 and now it's
better to use sys.maxsize.
https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.0.html#integers

Change-Id: I5af1537ae04a16454f20040e01ec64a6454171a2
Closes-Bug: #1628830
(cherry picked from commit 6a8e88de823f562b3b785a13e5cc31523475cc49)

commit_message:
Use HAProxy for docker-registry endpoint

The docker tooling has a preference for interacting with encrypted
endpoints. Terminating the docker-registry endpoint with HAProxy
allows the SSL VIP to be used for this purpose.

Change-Id: Ifebfa7256e0887d6f26a478ff8dc82b0ef5f65f6

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 16:39:30.000000000', 'files': ['MANIFEST.in'], 'message': "Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

networking-ovn already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
    pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I55a0faaa4ee5fa02f327c60fd88d1879cf788879
"}]
commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

networking-ovn already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
    pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I55a0faaa4ee5fa02f327c60fd88d1879cf788879

commit_message:
Refactoring config options for cache_utils opts

Refactoring neutron cache_utils config opts to be in neutron/conf so that all
the configuration options for cache_utils reside in a centralized location.
This simplifies the process of looking up the cache_utils config opts and
provides an easy way to import.

Change-Id: I722a2fa7d72c62e6d878d0137f899d09a9ad64ae
Partial-Bug: #1563069

commit_message:
Allow for wait in _restore_password

The _restore_password method within the
test_user_update_own_password() tests attempts to authenticate right
after changing a password. This patch makes it so that we wait one
second before attempt the authentication call, similar to the pattern
already established in the pre-existing test.

Change-Id: Ia51f28a70ae099f1ec93851d271db8556aced836

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-10-20 19:44:13.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/connection.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/ovsdb/native/test_connection.py'], 'message': "Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be included where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Closes-Bug: #1635395

Change-Id: I1c0620894d07d58efbba5226b5244fec950354ca
"}]
commit_message:
Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be included where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Closes-Bug: #1635395

Change-Id: I1c0620894d07d58efbba5226b5244fec950354ca

commit_message:
Fix default Swift ring partition power

Looks like swift::ringbuilder::part_power is not used at all; actually
the partition power on the overcloud is 18, which is the default in
puppet-swift if nothing else is defined.

Closes-Bug: 1631926
Depends-On: I78049105adf52226d47cc6764b1ba6c2c06e91e5
Change-Id: I65335c8d31ed1130e71f1e193eb519b9f7f2438e
(cherry picked from commit 1c8ef6c5e8473ccde3755710540225dbd74edb5b)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-21 09:10:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/tests/example/dir/subdir/__init__.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/tests/example/dir/subdir/example_module.py', 'neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Remove recursion from import_modules_recursively

Since the function already uses os.walk that will iterate through all
subdirectories for us, there is no need to recursively call the
function.

The recursive call was not just redundant, but also had another problem,
where we were passing relative paths to subdirectories, which made the
function to attempt importing modules that are not located under the
topdir. It could crash, or, worse, import a module that is
not under the expected parent directory.

This patch also modifies an existing unit test for the function to
validate that modules from subdirectories are also imported, even
without the recursive call.

Change-Id: I8b3a844460e4987b8a8375b01353d01e57d91604
Closes-Bug: #1634735
'}]
commit_message:
Remove recursion from import_modules_recursively

Since the function already uses os.walk that will iterate through all
subdirectories for us, there is no need to recursively call the
function.

The recursive call was not just redundant, but also had another problem,
where we were passing relative paths to subdirectories, which made the
function to attempt importing modules that are not located under the
topdir. It could crash, or, worse, import a module that is
not under the expected parent directory.

This patch also modifies an existing unit test for the function to
validate that modules from subdirectories are also imported, even
without the recursive call.

Change-Id: I8b3a844460e4987b8a8375b01353d01e57d91604
Closes-Bug: #1634735

subject: Add external_ipv4_floating_networks
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-20 17:03:42.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_neutron.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Add external_ipv4_floating_networks

Those network not properly tagged as external, even if the
provider is "physical_network" shouldn't be part of the list of
external networks. When shade tries to get a floating ip, made
use of this list, but neutron will fail if the network is not
configured as "router:external = True"

Change-Id: I2daa02805659ee2510a9203227d662161e60d51d
'}]
commit_message:
Add external_ipv4_floating_networks

Those network not properly tagged as external, even if the
provider is "physical_network" shouldn't be part of the list of
external networks. When shade tries to get a floating ip, made
use of this list, but neutron will fail if the network is not
configured as "router:external = True"

Change-Id: I2daa02805659ee2510a9203227d662161e60d51d

Also add a link to my post describing OVS 2.6, OVN's first release.

Change-Id: I1fa170e80a4717e122ce830267b2b6603025f1aa
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
README: Add more blog links.

Add a link to a fantastic series of OVN blog posts showing how to
exercise various OVN features.

Also add a link to my post describing OVS 2.6, OVN's first release.

Change-Id: I1fa170e80a4717e122ce830267b2b6603025f1aa
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

subject: Make trovestack able to run in the gate context
revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-10-20 18:50:26.000000000', 'files': ['integration/scripts/trovestack'], 'message': "Make trovestack able to run in the gate context

These changes are to make trovestack able to run in the dsvm-gate
context. The fundamental issue we're addressing is that the old
trove-integration was cloned into a writable area but in the current
(trove context) way of doing things, it is a read-only area. Therefore
you can't put the reports directory into the same relative place that
trove-integration would have done.

Change-Id: I449abf5a4ca574a2e9f5ddb1c8be507f5c5429a7
"}]
commit_message:
Make trovestack able to run in the gate context

These changes are to make trovestack able to run in the dsvm-gate
context. The fundamental issue we're addressing is that the old
trove-integration was cloned into a writable area but in the current
(trove context) way of doing things, it is a read-only area. Therefore
you can't put the reports directory into the same relative place that
trove-integration would have done.

Change-Id: I449abf5a4ca574a2e9f5ddb1c8be507f5c5429a7

commit_message:
Split Charm Author Docs into Anatomy and Template

The aim is to have a guide foe each template which is then supported
by a central Charm Anatomy. This change includes guides for API and
SDN. Guides for writing backends for Dashboard, Barbican, Cinder and
Heat should follow soonish.

Change-Id: I6d9578aa83c7c2a93aeb38c9ed9f38023fa8f873

commit_message:
Make Murano application provider use prefetch

Murano application provider is not idempotent,
so we need to make it use prefetch to fix this issue.

Change-Id: Iae5e04fdd320dc16eb03974f3632f58d5389b565

This is a partial revert of I7787daf025f4f14cf665db0366fa81f54adfa884.
We cannot use zuul-cloner in the periodic job right now since
zuul-cloner will reach out to a zuul-merger (thanks to a passed
environment variable) and that zuul-merger might not have the latest.
This is only hitting us in periodic jobs.

This leads to changes that have directly merge conflicts since they are
based on older jobs.

Use normal git commands for checking out - those go to git.openstack.org
instead to a zuul-merger.

Once zuul-cloner/zuul-merger is fixed, this change can get reverted
again.

Change-Id: I2dfac4c36ace4942840bf05048272fab0a0512ba
'}]
commit_message:
Fix translation proposal jobs

This is a partial revert of I7787daf025f4f14cf665db0366fa81f54adfa884.
We cannot use zuul-cloner in the periodic job right now since
zuul-cloner will reach out to a zuul-merger (thanks to a passed
environment variable) and that zuul-merger might not have the latest.
This is only hitting us in periodic jobs.

This leads to changes that have directly merge conflicts since they are
based on older jobs.

Use normal git commands for checking out - those go to git.openstack.org
instead to a zuul-merger.

Once zuul-cloner/zuul-merger is fixed, this change can get reverted
again.

Change-Id: I2dfac4c36ace4942840bf05048272fab0a0512ba

subject: Ensure that upper constraints are always applied
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-22 07:31:48.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/common-tasks/set-upper-constraints.yml', 'playbooks/lxc-hosts-setup.yml', 'playbooks/repo-build.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml', 'playbooks/repo-server.yml'], 'message': "Ensure that upper constraints are always applied

When the upper constraints are not applied, the resulting
build for the same tag may be different from one day to
the next. This results in an inconsistent experience for
deployers.

This patch sets the upper constraints to be used by the
following:
- https://review.openstack.org/388159 (lxc hosts)
- https://review.openstack.org/388072 (pip install)
- https://review.openstack.org/388230 (keystone install)
  This is a pattern to establish across other roles.

As some pip installs happen before the repo server is up
a common set of tasks is added to a few of the plays to
verify if there is a local copy of constraints available.
If not it will then source the upstream constraints based
on the OpenStack requirements SHA that's been pinned.

Manual backport of:
https://review.openstack.org/388220

Change-Id: I7ddd44be30c610609c1429147646dcb1d3e6ca59
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that upper constraints are always applied

When the upper constraints are not applied, the resulting
build for the same tag may be different from one day to
the next. This results in an inconsistent experience for
deployers.

This patch sets the upper constraints to be used by the
following:
- https://review.openstack.org/388159 (lxc hosts)
- https://review.openstack.org/388072 (pip install)
- https://review.openstack.org/388230 (keystone install)
  This is a pattern to establish across other roles.

As some pip installs happen before the repo server is up
a common set of tasks is added to a few of the plays to
verify if there is a local copy of constraints available.
If not it will then source the upstream constraints based
on the OpenStack requirements SHA that's been pinned.

Manual backport of:
https://review.openstack.org/388220

Change-Id: I7ddd44be30c610609c1429147646dcb1d3e6ca59

commit_message:
Fix cleanup-images fails

Fix failed cleanup-images for images with
duplicate id.

To remove images with duplicate id is necessary force it.

Co-Authored-By: Thiago Gomes <thiago.gomes@lsbd.ufc.br>
Change-Id: I47f424ccb1f21be4d42bc286e0a16616cebf1f31
Closes-Bug: #1551917

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-20 02:44:05.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_virt_detect.yml'], 'message': 'Identify virt type of PowerVM and KVM on Power

Using platform and model values as the criteria to distinguish KVM
on Power from PowerVM. Further info of platform and model is listed below.
- Host for KVM on Power
  platform        : PowerNV
  model           : 8247-22L
- VM running on KVM on Power
  platform        : pSeries
  model           : IBM pSeries (emulated by qemu)
- PowerVM (VM or NovaLink host)
  platform        : pSeries
  model           : IBM,8247-22L

Change-Id: I3d19ada78038caafdb3a89e8ddf5a91041e31e60
'}]
commit_message:
Identify virt type of PowerVM and KVM on Power

Using platform and model values as the criteria to distinguish KVM
on Power from PowerVM. Further info of platform and model is listed below.
- Host for KVM on Power
  platform        : PowerNV
  model           : 8247-22L
- VM running on KVM on Power
  platform        : pSeries
  model           : IBM pSeries (emulated by qemu)
- PowerVM (VM or NovaLink host)
  platform        : pSeries
  model           : IBM,8247-22L

Change-Id: I3d19ada78038caafdb3a89e8ddf5a91041e31e60

commit_message:
Ensure that upper constraints are always applied

When the upper constraints are not applied, the resulting
build for the same tag may be different from one day to
the next. This results in an inconsistent experience for
deployers.

This patch sets the upper constraints to be used by the
following:
- https://review.openstack.org/388159 (lxc hosts)
- https://review.openstack.org/388072 (pip install)
- https://review.openstack.org/388230 (keystone install)
  This is a pattern to establish across other roles.

As some pip installs happen before the repo server is up
a common set of tasks is added to a few of the plays to
verify if there is a local copy of constraints available.
If not it will then source the upstream constraints based
on the OpenStack requirements SHA that's been pinned.

Change-Id: I7ddd44be30c610609c1429147646dcb1d3e6ca59

commit_message:
Add upgrade playbook for ceilometer-api

ceilometer-api is served with Apache mod_wsgi. Add an upgrade playbook
to handle stopping the existing running service and removing its init
script.

Implements: blueprint upgrade-mitaka-newton
Depends-On: I417f366e343a7b764e3bcd9ab75efc3a233b460b
Related-Change: I3cff6b183feae3c346cd56602d7b733a6dd9a01b
